217501.name: Burgers 2
217501.description:
User Summary

Fight, Survive, and Eat Burgers.

217502.name: Flower Design
217502.description:
User Summary

A flower arrangement simulation game.

217503.name: Rising
217503.description:
User Summary

Battle trough hordes of enemies to find the source of a hellish invasion fueled by an ancient artifact.

217504.name: Crowtel Renovations
217504.description:
User Summary

Chirp through 9 levels of mayhem and check a few disruptive tenants out in an attempt to fix up this trashy vacation spot and save a little crow's job.

217505.name: The Lepak Game
217505.description:
Malaysianised card game based on the same engine as Cards against Humanity.

START
Choose a ‘Boss’ (the judge)
Boss deals all players 8 cards

MATCH
Boss displays and reads aloud a Yellow card
All players (except the Boss) match a Blue card within their hand to the Yellow card

BODEK
Players bodek (persuade) the Boss to choose their card
Boss picks a winner

217506.name: El Hijo
217506.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





El Hijo is a spaghetti western, indie stealth game.
The game is set in a mythical place of the 19th century that very much resembles the American west, as we know it from Sergio Leone‘s westerns, taking some of its most popular characteristics of outlaw gangs, saloons, cunning, sarcasm, irony, etc. There is no indication of a specific time, or place. It could be everywhere and anywhere.You guide 6-year old boy El Hijo on his quest to find his father, by escaping a monastery, fighting his way through the desert and avoiding monstrous creatures, and outsmarting horrible gangsters in the saloon of a villain town.
The game will be released for mobile and steam in the summer of 2017.

Source: The Developer Website.

217507.name: Make You Kingdom!!
217507.description:
From the introduction:

The Kingdom is a small community inside The Dungeon that the players rule. Although it is referred to as a Kingdom for convenience's sake, it could be a village, a school, a company, or any other type of small group. Typically, in Make You Kingdom, all of the players take control of one Kingdom and, as its members, attempt to raise and nurture it. The Kingdom's assets can be thought of as being the collective assets of all the characters attached to it.

217508.name: Make You Kingdom!! Game
217508.description:
User summary:

The "Game Master" guide focuses primarily on the traditional role-playing aspects of the game, including character creation and advancement, and small-party adventuring.

217509.name: Make You Kingdom!! Kingdom
217509.description:
User summary:

The "Kingdom" guide focuses primarily on the shared Kingdom the players cooperate to protect, expand, and improve.

Note the game rules are published on cards, though the cards are not used like typical cards - they are simply the rules printed on cards.

217510.name: A Race to the Moon
217510.description:
A children's space themed board game played by moving playing pieces along numbered squares till they reach the moon. Starting from earth, the first to get to the moon is the winner. Along the way players will encounter picture squares which have either set back or speed up their travel.

Playing pieces are simple counters and the board has graphics very similar to the British Dan Dare space caricature. Published about 1957 by Emu Series in the U.K.

217512.name: Race.Thru.Space
217512.description:
The purpose of this spin and move vintage space exploration game is to travel to as many planets as possible on the playing board starting at the rocket launching platform spot. The planets are located around the edge of a Monopoly style layout. Each player receives the celestial currency called Celestros upon visiting a planet. Players can encounter setbacks and benefits along the way by landing on specific squares. The game is over when all players return to the Launching Platform. The player with the greatest amount of currency wins the game.

The game has beautiful box graphics typical of the 50s era. The board has the spinner built into it and the playing pieces are colored plastic rockets very similar to that produced by the Lido corporation and seen in the board game Rocket Race to Saturn (1953). Rules are printed on the inside of the box lid and the game was produced by the E-Z game Manufacturing Corporation, New York.

217513.name: Lanterns: Snowflake Promo Tile
217513.description:
Originally available in Santa's Renegades 2016

Remove one other random tile and replace it with this tile. Follow other regular setup rules.

217514.name: Space: A Race to the Moon
217514.description:
A roll and move electronic space race board game starting at the Woomera rocket range in Australia. The first to reach the moon is the winner. Two players each have a wired playing piece (electrode) that they move by the roll of the die. The electrode piece advances along small holes in the board towards the moon passing planets along the way. Each player has to follow a separate route to the moon made of these small holes. At certain contact points along the way the playing piece sets off one of a series a colored warning lights on the board that indicates a penalty sending them back to a planet. On reaching the moon a yellow light in the moons center indicates the winner.

Unknown publisher but most likely Australian or English considering the unique launch zone where rocket testing was conducted during the 1950s

217515.name: Space Pilot
217515.description:
A space exploration spinning top board game. The object of the game is to spin and steer four capsule travel tops into the solar system game board and attempt to land on planets to win points. To win, tally up all points to make the highest possible score.

Each player spins three yellow tops. The yellow capsule tops spins on the playing board and the player tilts the board to make the tops travel into the solar system and stop in a circular hole representing a planet and score points. This is repeated with one red top to score double points. Trouble if you land on the sun, either losing half your points if it was a yellow top or all points if your red capsule stops on the sun. The player having the highest score after spinning all four tops is the winner.

217516.name: Scratshow
217516.description:
Description from the game insert:

During the same sitting, you can find yourself at the Casino, at the race, at an auction, or playing a friendly game of poker... all the while scratching cards to find out if you have a chance to win or if you have lost your bid. Scratshow starts with a roll of the dice telling you where your pawn will land. Are you on a Poker square? Take a scratch card marked Poker and discover your hand. Place your bet, bluff, raise... Your pawn takes you to the races? Place your bet, scratch a card and find out if your horse is in the Win, Place or Show category. The first player who gets to be a millionaire wins the game.

217517.name: The Great Dictionary Game
217517.description:
Description from the box insert:

A game where the scholar is not necessarily the winner. A game where wits provide for hilarity. The Great Dictionary Game is a fun-filled search for the definition of a word picked out of the dictionary and starting with one or more of the letters appearing on a card chosen at random. Proposed definitions can be absolutely accurate, a figment of the imagination, incoherent, plausible, misleading or humorous. The winner is the player with the highest score of points obtained either from his bets on accurate definitions or from votes of players.

217518.name: Watch Academy VI: Hogswatchnight - Their First Patrol!
217518.description:
User summary:

A Discworld Adventure for GURPS and Over The Edge.

217519.description:
Description from the publisher:

The B-26 has arrived in the European Theater of Operations. It has now joined the B-17, B-24 and the Lancaster over the skies of war torn Europe...

B-26: The Marauder Strikes! is a solitaire game set onboard a Martin B-26 Marauder medium bomber during World War Two in the European Theater of Operations from July 1943 until the end of the war in May 1945. It is a big game in that there are many target lists, rules, mission maps and details which are not found in B-17: Queen of the Skies or B-29 Superfortress: Bombers over Japan. For example, the Damage Tables are more detailed than the earlier games and the combat system is similar, but completely new. The Target Lists include a large selection of targets attacked by B-26s from July 1943 until the end of the war in May 1945 and are placed on 13 maps (Movement Boards) which are different depending on where your base is located, from England to the Netherlands. Different models of the B-26 is also included from the early B-26 in 1941 until the B-26G which entered combat in October 1944. The earlier models are not used in the European Theater of Operations (the ETO) in which B-26: The Marauder Strikes! is set, but will be used in 22nd Bomb Group: Marauders from Australia, an add-on variant set in the Pacific in the war against Japan in New Guinea.

Martin B-26 Marauder: The Wingless Wonder was the name of a variant of Avalon Hill's B-17: Queen of the Skies solitaire boardgame. A draft of B-26 was available for play testing which used the B-17: Queen of the Skies rules and B-17 was needed to play. Everything has changed since then, and B-26: The Marauder Strikes! has completely new mechanics and is a stand alone game.

Players familiar with B-17: Queen of the Skies or B-29 Superfortress: Bombers over Japan recognize the mechanics used in B-26. One or more 6-sided dice are rolled on tables to plan the mission, to determine if enemy fighters appear, to hit with machine gun fire and to determine damage and wounds and much more. In some ways it can be quicker to play a mission, but at the same time it can seem to be “dice-e-er” than its companions. B-26 is, with its advanced and optional guidelines, deep, detailed and complex, but still as easy to play as B-17 or B-29 with its basic system which is similar to the mechanics in B-17 or B-29.

You can begin your campaign flying missions from bases in England or jump in later in the war when the B-26 groups had moved to the continent and you will find Mission Maps with your station either in England, France, Belgium or the Netherlands depending on when you fly your missions. Put together a crew, name your B-26 and fly missions over France, Belgium, the Netherlands, Luxembourg, Germany, Austria and Czechoslovakia!
217519.name: B-26: The Marauder Strikes

217520.name: Freiheit für Schwarzenbrück: Teil 1
217520.description:
From publisher blurb:

Die Wahrheit bricht hervor!
Als die "Schwarzenbrücker Freiheit" das skandalöse Verhalten der Stadtregierung während des Großen Krieges anprangert, stürmt ein Mob das Redaktionsgebäude und schickt sich an, den Herausgeber zu lynchen.
Es liegt an den Charakteren, den grausigen Mord zu verhindern und dafür zu sorgen, dass Freiheit und Gerechtigkeit herrschen.

"Freiheit für Schwarzenbrück" ist eine Kampagne für das Finsterland-Rollenspiel. Sie besteht aus fünf Bänden. Das ist der erste Teil. Er beinhaltet eine vollständige Spielumgebung und viele Ideen, diese einzusetzen. Um dieses Buch zu nutzen, benötigen Sie das Finsterland-Grundbuch.

217521.description:
"A long time ago Erloth used the scraps of his trashed barrow to build a stall. He sold mead and wine there and after some time it developed into a little hut - The 'Drunken Troll Tavern.' Merchants, voyagers, and heroes frequented it freely and Gilda, Erloth's granddaughter, was well-known and liked.

Many times creatures ranged Andor but neither had they attacked it nor would anybody believe this the case. Until that fateful morning, as a farmer approached the heroes and gasped:

'Come quickly! The Drunken troll ravages the tavern!'"

This legend was designed by the users of the official German-language Andor forum from May to September 2014. Made up of over 70 cards it is one of the longest legends of Andor, with high variability, and it uses components from New Heroes and The Star Shield in new ways. Thank you to all the fans who contributed ideas and opinions.
217521.name: Legends of Andor: Tavern Turmoil

217523.name: The Real Stunt Experts
217523.description:
From manual
You play the part of Fred MacMuscle, the world's greatest stuntman. At least that is what it says on your publicity.

The truth is just a little bit less romantic and exciting - you have not worked in a milm for over 2 years and are beginning to get a little rusty. It also doesn't help that you are down on your last few thousand in the bank.

Luckily for you, the new series of RICKY STEEL - SECRET AGENT has just started filming in your area and you are asked if you will handle some of the stunts needed for the film. This is you big chance to become famous again. The only problem is that the film company expects you to have your own insurance. Luckily they afree to pay you for each stunt that you succesfully complete so the more stunts you try the more films you are able to take part in

Please note the C16 version of The Real Stunt Experts contains only one enhanced event

217524.name: The Complete Roslof Keep Campaign
217524.description:
From publisher blurb:

Come join the adventure with this comprehensive 136 page mega-dungeon! Compiling the full Roslof Keep Campaign adventures series from Folio 1-6, as well as supplemental mini-adventures 1.5-6.5 and the Nameless Realms Races supplement, this is a true monster of a dungeon crawl. Written in both 1E AD&D and 5E D&D mechanics, this huge text has been designed to mimic the essence of the classic 1980s 'Orange Spine' hardcovers by TSR and has an original cover by iconic artist Jeff Easley. With both 2D & 3D maps, Iconic Characters, campaign characters sheets, and more, this isn't something to miss out on if you are a true hard cover gamer.

217525.name: The Folio #10
217525.description:
From publisher blurb:

Finish the Hidden Valoria trilogy with a deep delve into the Lost Temple of Tefnut. Here, far below the streets of Valoria, the characters must brave dangers ranging from paralyzing hate crawlers, kobold trap masters, giant scorpions, a mummy lord and even a dragon! If they can survive these dangers, perhaps they will be able to twart the power play by the gangs of the Patina Court and come away as heroes. Only time and game play will tell. This module is the third part of the Hidden Valoria trilogy and is an adventure for characters levels 5th to 7th in 1st Edition and 5th Edition mechanics.

217526.name: The Folio #11
217526.description:
From publisher blurb:

Join the shared world anthology adventure stylings of Taux with the first adventure of the Taux Trilogy! Like entering Sanctuary in Thieves World, so too is Taux, City of Cursed Stone which was made famous in the Tales of the Emerald Serpent and A Knight in the Silk Purse fantasy series. This adventure is designed to place the characters in the action, meeting iconic characters from the fiction, and trying to avoid the betrayals of the greatest merchant house in the city. Can the party survive a single night on the run in Taux, or will the city claim their souls like so many others. This is a 1E & 5E mechanics adventure for characters levels 5-7.

217527.name: The Folio Digital Quarterly #1
217527.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventure awaits both AD&D & 5E D&D players looking to take on the challenges of a Steampunk style setting! Using Gary Gygax's notes from the original AD&D DMG under 'Sixguns & Sorcery' and incorperating them into the setting, this introductory gazetteer and adventure will give players the opportunity to use the Nameless Realms (Roslof Keep & Taux) as the backdrop in a later age, The Gun Kingdoms. Secure a ship, find a crew, and take on the xenophobic and apocalypic setting as you try to deliver a spy back to the government she stole from. Will your players become part of the 'greater good' of the new world government, or will they become its opposition, striving to help the dying race of the Enlightened? Only time will tell. This adventure is for introductory characters levels 1-3.

217528.name: Skyjet
217528.description:
Skyjet is a video game published by Mastertronic in 1985 for Commodore 64 , in which you control a helicopter in action and combat both of transport. He left directly in paperback and trade magazines judged him with average valuations to very good.

Gameplay
The scene is two dimensional, with side view of a horizontal-down environment in both directions, off a total of about four screens. The landscape is composed of areas of land and sea-sectional views.

The helicopter can move in four directions, with a partial effect of gravity, that you lose constantly share when you do not push the controls in any direction. It can shoot horizontally and release depth charges. The helicopter can withstand more hits before losing a life, but there is a power indicator.

The main enemies are ships or tanks, indestructible, patrolling the sea and the islands by firing anti-aircraft projectiles causing large explosions in the sky. But later hunting and futuristic aircraft that cross the horizontal area and may be affected. In addition, the submarine refueling through one at a time across the playing area; in themselves they are harmless, but if they can go is intensified the strength of the enemy.

One at a time, in different parts of the mainland, appear parcel of supplies that the helicopter has to collect and release on a special construction area. Packet delivered installation takes more shape, and to complete a level you have to end it.

Source: Wikipedia, "[it.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skyjet Skyjet]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

217529.description:
This cat is soooo moody!
He'll switch from happy to angry in one step.

In this game you play as a mischievous alley spirit on a mission to earn silver feather points by affecting Moody Cat's mood as he's prancing down your alley. As a spirit you are forbidden to affect the cat’s mood directly so you'll have to enlist help from other creatures. Keep in mind that there are other alley spirits competing for the points and will try to outsmart you in their efforts to earn more points than you. So unleash your spirit power to meddle with the Moody Cat.

Typically played as a set number of game rounds with score keeping after each game. The winner is determined after the last game in a set.
217529.name: Moody Cat

217530.name: Demonic Toupee
217530.description:
From publisher blurb:

Originally created by a trickster demon, the Demonic Toupee is often employed as a tool of revenge and conquest for those possessing the infernal knowledge needed to create it.

When placed on a living creature’s bald skin, it forces its way into their brain with hair-like tendrils and takes control of their body. With few natural defenses of its own, it will then do what it can to secure the life and safety of its host.

Having access to its victim’s memories, it will mimic their mannerisms to blend in. The Toupee can also trigger chemical reactions in their brain to increase their physical abilities.

Imbued with an endless drive to expand its influence, the Toupee sucks nutrients from its host to grow its body. Once its “hair” is long enough, it will cut off pieces of itself that then become new Demonic Toupees. Its offspring will defend and defer to their creator so long as they remain close by.

217531.name: Wizards Wanted
217531.description:
Enter the magical workforce as a nomadic wizard, wandering the fields and valleys to complete spell jobs. What is the ultimate goal? The greatest reward of all: fame.

As one of these enterprising wizards in Wizards Wanted, you must gather magical experience and coins for your work. Resourcefulness is essential as you pick up helpful mushrooms, buy magical dust from tricky pixies, and navigate the twisted paths and teleportation stones. But don't meander too much. You need to be in good standing with the Royal Palace and earn your Spell License by the end of the game, so get to work!

217532.name: Impact
217532.description:
From publisher blurb:

Engine of Destruction

Abel Shepherd joined the army to escape a troubled childhood. During combat, he was wounded and found a vine-covered temple to hole up in. Touching the wrong gem, he was trapped inside. Meanwhile 50 years passed. Transformed by the magical cocoon, Abel had become an engine of destruction. He emerged as Impact (PL 12), and is now compelled to seek out those who had wronged him in life and vent his wrath upon them.

Super Powered Legends. Because sometimes what you need is a character everyone will recognize, even if they’ve never met her before.

217533.name: Legendary Monks
217533.description:
From publisher blurb:

Masters of the Martial Arts

Monks are the undisputed masters of the martial arts in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, and when you peek under the hood in Legendary Monks you'll find 11 incredible new archetypes for traditional and unchained monks, from the thundering leikung to tempest speedsters, the savage singhala to the contemplative yogi, and the fanatic flagellant to the mind-melding psychic cenobite. You'll also find tons of new material for monks of every kind, including 10 new monk vows to build their ki, qinggong monk rules for psychic and occult powers, nearly three dozen monk tattoos from the carp and kappa to the rising sun and great wave, and over 20 new monk feats from Empty Hand Weapon and Wind of Scythes to Sevenfold Stone Curse and Soul of the Gun. A pair of ancient tomes of eldritch wisdom passed down from ancient revered masters completes this book in To Serve Stone's Stern Will and Text of Burning Wind and Iron Rain! Whatever kind of monk you play, you'll find a wealth of wonderful material here to bring even more excitement to the table and pain to your enemies.

217534.name: Yōkai Races
217534.description:
From publisher blurb:

Player Character Races from Legendary Japan

Yokai is a Japanese term that means a spirit or monster. It refers to a diverse number of supernatural creatures which could variously be described as ghosts, devils, ogres, and genies, and other monsters. The races in this book are either partly humanoid, or have characteristics in common with other humanoid creatures. They are somewhat otherworldly, but have recognizable similarities to beings of the world of mortals.
The yokai are an ever-changing group of creatures. Some date back to the folk tales of ancient Japan, while others have been conceived in recent decades. Yokai are a part of popular culture, including games, manga, and anime, taking on forms both new and traditional.

This book contains:

Hengeyokai - magical animals that take on human form
Kodama-hanyou - mortal descendents of woodland spirits
Korobokkuru - secretive and short in stature, but stalwart
Obake-hanyou - scions of a shapechanging bloodline
Oni-hanyou - children of the oni
Suijin-hanyou - descendents of great water spirits

217535.name: Summoner Spells V (PRD)
217535.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Summoner Spells is a simple document that collects the summoner spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 5th-level summoner spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

217536.name: Summoner Spells V (3PP)
217536.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Summoner Spells is a simple document that collects the summoner spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 5th-level summoner spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

217537.name: Far East Campaign Compendium
217537.description:
From publisher blurb:

This compilation includes the entire line of Far East Adventure Path titles: Imperial Heroes, Road to Destiny, Under Frozen Stars, The Baleful Coven, The Way Of Ki and Meditations of the Imperial Mystics.

Imperial Heroes: Pregenerated Characters. Our second set of 8 rules-legal, fully fleshed-out, ready-to-play pregenerated 1st level characters created specifically to shine in a Far East Adventure Path or any campaign with Asian influences, written Neil Spicer and the Legendary Games Design Team, including:

Akobi Thiesson, honor guard cavalier
Jin Thiesson, human rogue
Masato Koshin, martial artist monk
Caladrel Qoervari, bladebound magus
Saroune Anzoletta, scrollmaster transmuter
Kieyanna Waide, cleric of the Goddess of Love
Ragnar Bralgweir, invulnerable rager barbarian
and last but not least… Nurch, goblin ninja!




To top it all off, each character comes with preselected choices as they advance in the first few levels, and also include notes about their ultimate design goals so you know what you are working towards. We haven’t even mentioned the terrific full-color character portraits by Tanyaporn Sangsnit, Frank Hessefort, and Colby Stevenson!

Meditations of the Imperial Mystics brings together the sublime secrets of joining mind, body, and spirit with the study of magic as recorded by the revered masters and their fanatical acolytes in ages gone past. Though fragments of their unattainable wisdom have survived in bits and pieces, the true original sources are accounted as great treasures among those who hold them. Rarely have their mysteries been unfolded, but gathered together they wait for you. You will find 18 ki-related feats, from Mindworm and Recenter Flow to Dream Travel and Aura Absolution, as well as 6 new spells, from paradox to steal dying breath. In addition, these tomes contain unique ki training and ability enhancement rules through the study of esoteric texts of the ancient masters, broadening the powers of qinggong while exploring the deeper connections of ki, magic, and mysticism, including supernatural acupuncture, internalization of extreme yin and yang, linkage of mind, spirit, and fate through spirit-auras, and the mortification of the flesh to span the threshold of life and death.

Body Outside Body, a teak-covered tome whose inscrutable diagrams unfold the mysteries of ki auras and their connections to knowledge, wisdom, fate, and the mind.
The Instructions of Yin-Blood and Thundering Yang, a unique inverting scroll that read forwards explicates the malleability of cool, yielding yin while read in reverse exposes the eruptive possibilities of fulminant yang, and the proper channeling of each power.
Prayers of Empty Flesh & Undying Ki, recorded on an infinitely unspooling prayer wheel that draws the mind and soul more deeply the more its chant is intoned, unveils the secrets of straddling the borders of life and death, of making transcendent spirit master base flesh.
Seven-Ghost-Needles, an academic and clinical treatise on the inner flows of ki through the body and mind and how to focus and channel it through the dantian centers of jin, shen, and wuji.




Road to Destiny. A terrific sandbox adventure for 2nd-level characters! A legacy of death bears bitter fruit in the northern coastlands, as brothers long separated each rise to the call of their darkling heritage. A new destiny has arisen in the west that threatens to shake the foundations of an empire half a world away, but not if Ranulfr the White Wolf and his one-eyed sibling can waylay these would-be heroes on their Road to Destiny! Danger, treachery, and downright skullduggery lie around every turn, and characters will need their wits as well as their weapons if they hope to succeed. This adventure designed for 2nd-level characters offers the chance to earn additional experience during a Far East Adventure Path campaign as the heroes set out on their epic caravan journey to the far side of the world, or it can serve as a self-contained adventure sandbox adventure suitable for any campaign.

Road to Destiny marks the Legacy Games debut of not one but TWO superstar finalists: not only author Jim Groves but also cartographer extraodinaire Pedro Coelho! With fantastic artwork by the talented Jason Juta, Road to Destiny is a 24,000-word epic adventure you will not want to miss regardless of whether you are running the published Adventure Path.

The Baleful Coven. Battling a conspiracy to destroy the future empress before she can realize her imperial destiny, you have overcome all who stood in your way. As you set out to cross the endless cold lands at the top of the world, however, your enemies are not so quick to forgive or forget the dead left in your wake. A mother’s love is undying, but so too is her hate. In her eyes, you are murderers, and she will gather dark sisters from far abroad to draw you into a mystic nightmare from which there will be no escape!

This adventure for characters of 6th to 7th level supplements the epic journey through the northern wilds of the Far East Adventure Path campaign. It allows GMs to show the dynamic nature of the campaign world as forces they thought defeated turn out to have allies that do not take the defeat of their kin lightly. While easiest to include as part of the journey through the mountains of the subpolar north as their caravan approaches the arctic, scaling notes suggest methods for leveling up the adventure for use after the arctic crossing as the PCs’ caravan descends into the Eastern Realms. Apart from an Adventure Path, this adventure can be easily dropped into any campaign to infuse it with an air of malevolent witchery.

The Way of Ki. The power of ki lies latent within all things, flowing through mind, body, and spirit alike and able to be seen and harnessed by those with the focus, devotion, and dedication to master themselves and achieve perfect unity and balance. The game describes ki only in terms of the mystic powers manifested by the monk and ninja, and The Way of Ki contains a wealth of options for increasing the variety and flavor of what these classes can do through their mastery of meditative practice and transcendental contemplation. The power of ki, however, is universal, available to anyone with the focus, desire, and discipline to master it, and The Way of Ki allows characters of every class to unleash this power, adding it to or infusing it within their normal class abilities. Unlock the great mysteries and transcend the natural into the sublime. The game touches on these secrets only briefly, in the context of the mystic powers manifested by the monk and ninja. If ki truly represents the extension of the self into communion with the universe and its hidden flows, however, its secrets should be possible for anyone to master with the proper instruction and dedication. By exploring The Way of Ki, now they can!

You will find 22 general feats, from Composure and Ki Meditation to Sap Ki and Yogic Levitation. For the martially inclined, there are an additional 21 combat feats, including Hadouken, Mighty Kiai, Shattering Strike, and Unyielding Stance. For masters of the mystic arts, there are 16 magical feats including Graceful Calm, Perfected Creation, and Unbounded Conversion. Besides these 59 feats are notes for integrating ki and its use with every class in the game, including vows of discipline and their impact on ki, with special attention paid to expanded options for the the monk, ninja, and samurai.

Under Frozen Stars. On an epic journey across the far frozen wastes, your characters seek their destiny and that of the future empress. Yet at the top of the world, having overcome the ravening storms and dark forces arrayed against them, you discover a marvel of legend, a ruined city both ancient and alien. Surely you cannot simply pass it by without exploring it and seeing what mysteries have lain untouched for time out of mind. Then again, if the rumors told in the caravan are true, perhaps others have come not so long ago, leaving behind a mysterious treasure that may be of great aid in claiming your imperial destiny in the eastern realms.

This adventure for characters of 7th to 9th level supplements (with scaling notes to use the adventure with higher or lower-level adventurers) the epic journey at the midpoint of the Far East Adventure Path campaign. It allows PCs a chance to stop and explore one of the notable locations they discover along the way, helping balance out what can become an arduous grind of seemingly disconnected events on their polar crossing. Apart from an Adventure Path, this adventure serves as an excellent introduction to a desolate lost city hidden by nigh-impassable terrain, yet containing connections to past and future, where east meets west.

217538.description:
Congratulation ! you just made a burnout !
You wake up in a psychiatric hospital and doctor said "
No problem, in 30 years you go out".

The goal of the game is to make your imaginary friend guess as many words as possible within 40 seconds. Unfortunatly you take pills that restrict your language and your gestures. When it is again your team's turn, the player who made the patient becomes the imaginary friend but retains the effect of his pills. Guaranteed fun!
217538.name: Docteur Pilule

217540.name: Red Max
217540.description:
From cover
Your hibernating crew aboard the huge astroworld drift silently through space unaware of the fission mines being planted by the renegade Death Lords above.
Alerted by your P.C. you have only seconds to start up RED MAX

217541.name: Fissure
217541.description:
2 players

Materials
A hex board having 37 cells, 4 hexes to a side, and 37 stones in a single color

Setup
Place a stone, in each of the 37 cells of the board

Definitions
Group - one or more adjacent stones

Object
The player with the most stones wins

Play
Choose a starting player, turns alternate

On a turn remove 2 non-adjacent stones from a line of adjacent stones.

Clarifications
Removed stones are used for endgame scoring

If a group is split into 2 or more groups, the player that caused the split takes the smallest group, but if the smallest groups are of equal size, the player then decides which one to take

Endgame
The game ends when a player cannot take his turn

217542.name: 'Twas One Night In The Dungeon
217542.description:
From publisher blurb:

Walking’ Snowmen, hairy snow monsters, magical snow, magical coal, spells that cause hail to rain upon your enemies - all of that and more can be found when your character ventures into the world of cold wind, snow, and ice.

If you think your character is ready for the World of Winter, then PROVE IT! Come inside the icy lands and discover all the mysteries presented here, in ‘Twas One Night In The Dungeon.

Included in this book are 4 new cold-region themed monsters, 1 new Game Master Character, 4 new cold-region themed magical items, 2 new rituals, information on the Mid-Winter Celebration, and 1 new spell group.

This adventure can be played with as little as a Game Master and one player, or with a Game Master and several Players.

217543.name: Fantasy Dungeon Ball
217543.description:
From the introduction:

Have you ever heard sports fans talking obsessively about fantasy stats and been really confused?

Have you ever wanted to stock a dungeon with nasty monsters while simultaneously being a member of the party, but not in a weird, GMPC, Mary Sue kind of way?

FANTASY DUNGEON BALL IS THE GAME FOR YOU!

It’s a GM-less RPG for players who create a dungeon with monsters, traps, and treasure, and then run through it as a party. The more damage you and your hand-chosen monsters do, the more experience you get!

The system is both simple and needlessly complicated, while still being completely not dissatisfying for all players. And you don’t need a GM! Who needs them anyway? Too busy hiding behind a screen to look you in the eye as they mercilessly crush your character.

217544.name: Vanguard of War
217544.description: Vanguard of War (VoW) is a 1-4 player game focused on the defense of a small church deep inside the decaying ruins of a once great city now known only as “the Whispers.” Players will use their heroes to hold the line against seemingly endless waves of demons while their allies inside the church desperately attempt to learn how to use the fel army's own doomsday weapon against them.

217545.name: Dice'n Score! Farm
217545.description:
Description from the publisher:

In the Yahtzee-like dice game Dice'n Score! Farm, players get to throw the dice up to three times on their turn while attempting to make high-scoring sets of animals. Choose carefully which ones to score as each line of animals can be scored only once! If all the possible choices for a roll have been filled, then you must score zero points in another box of your choice.

If you score 18 or more points on the upper half of the score sheet, then you receive 10 bonus points. Roll five identical items, and you get a 10-point Big Farm bonus. Whoever has the highest score when all the score sheets are filled wins!

217546.name: Ambyria: Starlight & Vengeance
217546.description:
Description from the publisher:

Starlight & Vengeance is the expansion to Shroud of the Shadow Demon. Starlight & Vengeance includes two entirely new decks, represented by heroes, Melevanie and Ingduhl.

Like in Shroud of the Shadow Demon, your goal is to collect more Ember Stones than your opponent. The expansion offers new cards and strategies for you and your friends to play with.

217547.description: To win at Can't Stop Express, you need the courage to take risks, but also the ability to predict and plan. After each throw of the five dice, you try to choose the best combination of two pairs while also making a good choice for the fifth die. Through this effort, you are awarded points, and whoever has the most points at the end of the game — which usually takes 24-25 rolls — wins.
217547.name: Can't Stop Express
boardgamepodcastepisode: #40: A Feast for Odin six-pack; Burger Up on tap; New York Slice & More
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 038 – Jamaica vs Thunder Alley vs Race! Formula 90

217548.name: Endless Fables: The Minotaur's Curse
217548.description:
Welcome to the magical world of the very first game of the Endless Fables series. This amazing adventure revolves around the legend of the Greek Mythological figure, the Minotaur and is set in numerous locations from the romantic city of Paris to the mythical island of Crete.

During the perilous journey you will have to escape a secret sect and end up in the labyrinth of the Minotaur. You have to stop the Minotaur from reviving and save the lives of your loved ones from the raging beast. Join Pamela Cavendish on her marvelous adventure in the enchanting mythological world.

Source: The Developer Website.

217549.name: Tales from the Yawning Portal
217549.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the shadows grow long in Waterdeep and the fireplace in the taproom of the Yawning Portal dims to a deep crimson glow, adventurers from across the Sword Coast spin tales and spread rumors of lost treasures. Some of yarns overheard by Durnan, the barkeep of the Yawning Portal, are inspired by events in far-flung lands, or even other worlds across the Planes, and these tales have been collected into a single volume.

Within this tome are seven of the most compelling dungeons from the 40+ year history of Dungeons & Dragons. Some are classics that have hosted an untold number of adventurers, while others were some of the most popular adventures ever printed.

The seeds of these stories now rest in your hands. D&D’s most storied dungeons are now part of your modern repertoire of adventures. Enjoy, and remember to keep a few spare character sheets handy.

For use with the fifth edition Player’s Handbook, Monster Manual, and Dungeon Master’s Guide, this book provides fans with a treasure trove of adventures, all of which have been updated to the fifth edition rules. Explore seven deadly dungeons in this adventure supplement for the world’s greatest roleplaying game:

Against the Giants
Dead in Thay
Forge of Fury
Hidden Shrine of Tamoachan
Sunless Citadel
Tomb of Horrors
White Plume Mountain

217553.description:
Using four cones, three scoops, two hands and one challenge card in Go Go Gelato!, you want to scoop your way to victory as quickly as you can.

To start the game, each player takes four cones (one of each color) and three scoops of gelato (in three of the four colors), then places those scoops in the matching cones. Someone reveals a challenge card, then everyone races to maneuver the right scoops into the right cones — all without dropping the scoops or touching them by hand. No one will want to eat that! Fulfill the order first, and you claim the challenge card. Whoever collects five challenge cards first wins!
217553.name: Go Go Gelato!

217554.name: Dr. Microbe
217554.description:
Can you grab the microbes you need?

In each round of Dr. Microbe, you're presented with a challenge card that shows some combination of microbes and (possibly) a superbug. Each player has tweezers and a petri dish that's divided into three small sections and one large one. As soon as the card is revealed, players must race to place the microbes (and superbug, if present) in their petri dish. What's more, they must figure out which microbes (and possibly the superbug) to place in their petri dish based on this rule: The superbug must always be a different shape and color than the other three microbes in your dish! Whoever fills their dish with the proper items first claims the challenge card, and whoever first grabs five cards wins the game!

As a variant, you can play with the purple virus, which starts the game in the large petri dish that contains all of the other bits. You can grab this purple virus and place it in the petri dish of your left-hand neighbor, then that person can pass it left, etc. You can't end the round if the purple virus is in your petri dish! Whoever has the purple virus in their dish at the end of the round must give one of their previously collected cards to that round's winner.

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
217555.name: The Meat Gods
217555.description:
A Short OSR Horror Adventure for 4 - 6 First Level Characters

From the introduction:

Off the coast of Sharoom (or whatever continent your campaign takes place on) there is a farming community on Autumn Island. The shores are rocky and sharp, and the waves come crashing high into the air during storms, but strangely the soil of Autumn Island is extremely fertile. The people of Autumn Island are rather shut in, and rarely visit the mainland.

217556.name: Adventure Catalysts: The Fey Abductions
217556.description:
A Randomly Generated RPG Adventure Outline for Any System

From the introduction:

Adventure Catalysts are designed to be the skeletal outline of an adventure that you can flesh out with your imagination using your favorite RPG system. Each adventure has a main plot that is flavored in the fantasy realm, but you can reflavor the adventure in any genre or even within the genre. It’s just a basic adventure plot. Each of the next items can be generated on the following page by hitting the corresponding button.

rpgseries: A World of Adventure for Fate Core System
217557.name: Andromeda
217557.description:
Epic Space Opera in an Alien Galaxy

Publisher's blurb:

A world ship adrift. A hostile alien galaxy.

Humanity has arrived in the Andromeda galaxy in great, slower-than-light space arks, fleeing the wave front of a devastating explosion of the Milky Way’s core. In order to survive, they must find a new home in a hostile galaxy. Aboard their world-ship, the elite pursue secret centuries-spanning agendas on behalf of—or despite—the powerful factions that shape shipboard society.

You are members of the elite—leaders, scientists, and moral figureheads.Strive to outmaneuver your rivals and deal with the dangers of Andromeda, including alien empires that resist the arrival of human beings. Command solar-scale tools and planet-shattering weapons. Will you lead humanity into survival or extinction?

217558.name: Frozen Pillar
217558.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A world ship adrift. A hostile alien galaxy.

Humanity has arrived in the Andromeda galaxy in great, slower-than-light space arks, fleeing the wave front of a devastating explosion of the Milky Way’s core. In order to survive, they must find a new home in a hostile galaxy. Aboard their world-ship, the elite pursue secret centuries-spanning agendas on behalf of—or despite—the powerful factions that shape shipboard society.

You are members of the elite—leaders, scientists, and moral figureheads.Strive to outmaneuver your rivals and deal with the dangers of Andromeda, including alien empires that resist the arrival of human beings. Command solar-scale tools and planet-shattering weapons. Will you lead humanity into survival or extinction?

217559.name: Profiler
217559.description:
Description from the publisher:

A game of cooperative atmosphere!

Play in the same team to try to find the right character among 6. For example, who would parachute jump and look after his looks? Dracula or Lady Gaga? Put yourself in agreement and prove that you are the best team of Profilers!

217560.name: Sunk!
217560.description: Sunk! is a skill and action game in which the task is to add water — one drop at a time — to the cup floating in the water-filled tank without causing it to sink. You're not simply pouring water, though, as the game involves challenge cards as well. Can you pour with only one eye open? What about when you're hopping on one foot?

217561.name: Best of Greyhawk #01
217561.description:
Notes from Roger Moore
Druids in Greyhawk
Greyhawk Chronology

User summary:

Best of Greyhawk is a series of items containing materials derived from the long-defunct "AOL/TSR Greyhawk Message Board", an electronic bulletin board system. Selections were made by long-time forum administrators.

217562.name: Best of Greyhawk #02
217562.description:
Posted Messages from TSR's Roger Moore
A Vision of Celene
Lost Gods of Greyhawk
Keoland

User summary:

Best of Greyhawk is a series of items containing materials derived from the long-defunct "AOL/TSR Greyhawk Message Board", an electronic bulletin board system. Selections were made by long-time forum administrators.

217563.name: Best of Greyhawk #03
217563.description:
Knightly Orders
Ket
The Plague Years
Greyhawk Renaissance
Heraldry in the Flanaess

User summary:

Best of Greyhawk is a series of items containing materials derived from the long-defunct "AOL/TSR Greyhawk Message Board", an electronic bulletin board system. Selections were made by long-time forum administrators.

217564.name: Nibbled
217564.description:
Description from the publisher:

Nibbled is a fast-paced, easy-to-learn game that starts with kids clipping four plastic fish onto themselves. Guess a color, then flip a card. Guess correctly, and you unclip one fish and clip it onto an opponent. Whoever first unclips all of their fish wins!

217565.name: Best of Greyhawk #04
217565.description:
The Fourth Continent: An Overview of Anakeri
A History of the Bright Desert
The Great Kingdom: Noble Politics in the Kingdom of Aerdy
The Great Kingdom: The Flanmi River, Thelly River, and Coach Routes of the Kingdom of Aerdy
St. Cuthbert, Heironeous, and Trithereon
Revising the Cleric: Suggestions for Oerthian Clerics

User summary:

Best of Greyhawk is a series of items containing materials derived from the long-defunct "AOL/TSR Greyhawk Message Board", an electronic bulletin board system. Selections were made by long-time forum administrators.

217566.name: Pinball (1991 / CD-i)
217566.description:
From European cover
Here is the entire Pinball Arcade purely for YOU - with full sound effects and four greatr playing fields to choose from - the robotic CYBER field, DOG FIGHT where you're a World Wae I fighter pilot, SPRING BREAK where you ride the waves and MELTDOWN is pure nuclear!

From French cover (Flipper Interactif)
* See an entire pinball arcade with flashinglights, full digital sound effects and challenging playing fields materialize before your eyes. * The robotic CYBER combines fast action with a complicating factor: A magnet pops up from the robot's chest. Try to launch the ball from the magnet for higher scores.* Enter the fray of World War I in DOG FIGHT. Your mission is to shoot down Fokkers and other planes as you traverse the war-tone countryside. Your flippers have gas tanks on them so don't use them carelessly! * SPRING BREAK is filled with beach babes, surfer dudes and major wave action. Try to spell the words "spring break" by hitting the beach balls. Once you do, take a trip into the local cafe for bonus scores.
* MELTDOWN is totally nuclear! It's your mission to set the control rids so you can get into the reactor core for full linear acceleration. * Are you adept enough to do it?

217567.name: Best of Greyhawk #05
217567.description:
The City of Hardby
Joramy
The City of Dyvers
Oerth's Dwarves
Instant Greyhawk Campaigns
Starting in Saltmarsh

User summary:

Best of Greyhawk is a series of items containing materials derived from the long-defunct "AOL/TSR Greyhawk Message Board", an electronic bulletin board system. Selections were made by long-time forum administrators.

217568.name: Best of Greyhawk #06
217568.description:
Town of Womtham
Town of Cryllor
The Origin of St. Cuthbert
Cuthbert and the Sundering
City of Hardby... Again

User summary:

Best of Greyhawk is a series of items containing materials derived from the long-defunct "AOL/TSR Greyhawk Message Board", an electronic bulletin board system. Selections were made by long-time forum administrators.

217569.name: Best of Greyhawk #07
217569.description:
Quasi-Deities of Greyhawk
Naval Technology
Beowulf the Bold Barbarian
Gem of the Flanaess: After the Great Fire
Gem of the Flanaess: Monsters of the City
Ehlonnic Mystery Cults
Pantheons of the Flanaess
Dyvers
Al-Qadim

User summary:

Best of Greyhawk is a series of items containing materials derived from the long-defunct "AOL/TSR Greyhawk Message Board", an electronic bulletin board system. Selections were made by long-time forum administrators.

217571.name: Best of Greyhawk #08
217571.description:
Al-Qadim
Imperial Keoland: A Timeline
Vecna: Bad to the Bone
The Bandit Kingdoms and Stoink
Pantheons of the Flanaess
Greyhawk Adventures
Languages of Greyhawk
The Country of Nyrond

User summary:

Best of Greyhawk is a series of items containing materials derived from the long-defunct "AOL/TSR Greyhawk Message Board", an electronic bulletin board system. Selections were made by long-time forum administrators.

217572.name: Best of Greyhawk #09
217572.description:
Beyond the Sea of Dust
Caravan Routes of Greyhawk
Greyhawk Powers
Sea Routes of Greyhawk
Vampire Councils of Greyhawk

User summary:

Best of Greyhawk is a series of items containing materials derived from the long-defunct "AOL/TSR Greyhawk Message Board", an electronic bulletin board system. Selections were made by long-time forum administrators.

217573.name: Best of Greyhawk #10
217573.description:
Horror in Greyhawk
Koravia
A Plague Years Campaign: The Godwalkers
Prisoners of Zagig
Pantheons of the Flanaess
The Continent of Hepmonaland

User summary:

Best of Greyhawk is a series of items containing materials derived from the long-defunct "AOL/TSR Greyhawk Message Board", an electronic bulletin board system. Selections were made by long-time forum administrators.

217576.name: Hellenica: Story of Greece
217576.description:
An explosion of creativity and violence erupted in the Aegean Basin in 800 B.C. that defined ancient Greece. This combination of science, mythology, development, and war was led by powerful city-states like Athens, Sparta, Corinth, Troy, Byzantium, Corcyra, and Thebes. These states vied for control over their rivals and dominated the lesser states around them. In time, some of them became so well known that they are remembered even today.

Hellenica: Story of Greece is a 3.5X civilization game in which you harness the powers of one of seven beginning city-states to dominate the world around you. Your goal is to become the preeminent symbol of Greece for all posterity by completing a combination of secret and public goals. Will you be remembered as a warmonger or a peaceful philosopher? Great priest or apostate? Will you develop a devotion to the gods or focus on the advancement of your people?

Can you guide your civilization during these turbulent times? Will your vision of Hellenic civilization be remembered for all time, or will you merely be a stepping stone for another…?

217578.name: Coup: Socialist
217578.description:
Dice Tower Season 13 kickstarter on Indiegogo

Provided x6 Socialist cards that can replace the Ambassador role.

217579.name: The Lion Guard Gut gebrüllt, Kion!
217579.description:
From the publisher:

An exciting race with the heroes from the TV series "The Guard of the Lions".

The little lion Kion is leader of the "Guard the Lion", they protect the sacred land. From his vantage point on the King's Rock, Kion discovers some wandering hyenas, which always cause trouble. With loud roar, he calls his friends for help! Who will win the exciting race and be the first at Kion?

217580.name: Quatsch Koffer packen
217580.description:
From the Publisher:

"I'm packing into my suitcase ..." - and the number of things being remembered is getting longer! Now two games in one: classic with travel luggage or even witty with crazy grimaces and movements!

"I pack in my suitcase ..." and the series of memorized things is getting longer. Now two games in one: classic with travel luggage or even witty with crazy grimaces and movements!
The classic is even more fun now!

217581.name: Kronia
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 20: The one all about CMON Expo
217581.description:
Description from the publisher:

It's time for a new leader to be selected by the gods to lead the nation. To help sway their decision, players must make offers to win their favor.

In Kronia, favor tokens are placed in three different temples, then players will make secret offers to these temples over the course of twelve rounds. Everyone starts with the same offer cards, so they must anticipate which Gods other players want to please. Deciding when to spend the more appealing offers and when to hold off can be the difference. In the end, the player with the most points from their favor tokens will be chosen to lead the nation into the future.

217582.name: Monopoly: Longhorn Edition
217582.description:
Description from the publisher:

Monopoly, the legendary game of risk taking, deal making, and owning it all, and The University of Texas at Austin, the celebrated university of academics, research, and national championships, team up to create a classic board game for Longhorm fans everywhere. Take a spin around the board to find the best loved athletes, coaches, buildings and scenes of one of America's great universities. And be prepared to pay big bucks if you land on the Tower or Littlefield Fountain-the University's most recognized building and beloved spot on campus don't come cheap!

Grab your friends and family put on your Longhorn sweatshirt and enter the halls of UT at Austin for the game of your life. The Texas Union, Show Band of the Southwest, Darrell Royal, Littlefield Home or 99 other Longhom properties can all be yours. Whether a student, alumnus or fan, can you resist the chance to buy Texas' finest?

GAME INCLUDES: Game Board Property Cards. Play Money and Bankers Tray. 2 Dice 10 Game Tokens. Chance Cards Community Chest Cards Package of Houses. Package of Dormitories

217583.name: Monster Wanted!
217583.description:
From the publisher:

On the monster party secretly two escaped. Let's go to the search: With good memory, the players quickly find out who is missing!

The Monster Party It's suddenly haywire. Of the six monsters, two monsters have disappeared and the players are looking for the right. If you can remember well which monsters are still at the party, you win the game.

217584.name: Mauseschlau & Bärenstark Rund um die Natur
217584.description:
From the publisher

A memorabilia and collecting game with mouse squeaky and bearish actions!

With Mauseschlau & Bärenstark It's in the nature! There the players learn local animals, flowers, tree and berry fruits. In addition, they can show how well they can represent animals and imitate animal voices. If you also show some skill in gyros and a good memory, the first to collect 6 picture cards and win

217585.name: Trivial Pursuit: The 1980's Card Set
217585.description: Subsidiary expansion cards for use with Trivial Pursuit: The 1980's Master Game.

217586.name: Commanders of Land and Sea
217586.description:
Description from the publisher:

You are a young Captain, in charge of your own fleet of ships, seeking fame and fortune.

In Commanders of Land and Sea you take the role of the Captain of a fleet of ships that seeks to expand its domain, your goal is to take over as many islands as possible, placing your boats in them, claiming their treasures and increasing your power; At the same time you must eliminate the other players, destroying their ships and taking possession of their main ports.

You have found an area of the ocean where there are several islands that are not under any kingdom or country, it is your duty to land on them and reclaim them along with their wealth as your own. But be careful, other corsairs, have also established themselves in nearby ports, and are also in search of new domains, you must face them and prove to them who is the most powerful, using your ships and wealth to eliminate their ships and drive them away.

What are you waiting? Have fun sailing your ships, conquering islands landing in their ports and increase your wealth; face your opponents and if necessary send them flying by exploding your traps. Who will be the most successful Captain? You will have to play to find out.

217587.name: Adventure Quarterly (Issue 8 - Oct 2016)
217587.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Welcome to the latest issue of Adventure Quarterly, now with new hand drawn cartography by Tommi Salama and all original art to help create encounters and stories you want to be a part of. Where creative designers cut their teeth, or continue to sink seasoned canines, into the meat of what makes an enjoyable adventure.

It’s been a trek, almost a quest, through seven issues of Adventure Quarterly to reach this eighth issue. Like any new frontier, this one is packed with adventures and surprises.

We’ve Race for the Cage by Haakon Sullivan, wherein a party of 4th level PC’s are embroiled in a race against both time and cultists who seek to release a horrible beast.

Next, there’s the sixth installment of Ruins Perilous by Michael Welham, within which 6th level characters discover The Test Lab and its…let’s say, unusual machinations. There are also some unruly ratfolk and their disgruntled grievances to worry about.

Lastly, we find ourselves looking at a deliverable from Kickstarter campaign, The Vault of Shaju by Craig Campbell with Ben McFarland. The PCs enter the employ of a lore master. They must escort him to the Vault of Shaju. However, it’s-of course- not as simple as it seems. Ninth level PCs should find life very interesting here.

Welcome to Adventure Quarterly. They say pain brings wisdom. We hope you use this issue to make some PC’s very, very wise.

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
217588.name: Black Pudding #2
217588.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Shlep! Shlock! Here glorps issue #2 of Black Pudding, an OSR-styled zine of RPG goodness. It's a lurid conglomeration of hand-drawn bits and digital bobs to use at your table. Zlort this zine with Labyrinth Lord, Swords & Wizardry, OSRIC, or whatever you like.

This issue features goodies from the depraved minds of Matt Hildebrand and Karl Stjernberg. Character classes such as the Blind Guardian and Mouldwarp, The Vault of the Whisperer, Mace of the Ape King, a bunch of jerk NPCs, some magic weapons, death spells, and more!

217589.name: Living Greyhawk Campaign Sourcebook
217589.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the Living Greyhawk Campaign Sourcebook. This document contains everything that you, as a player or Dungeon Master, need to participate in the largest Living Campaign in the history of the RPGA (Role Playing Games Association). Whether you are new to the concept of a “Living” game or a seasoned veteran you will find answers to all of your questions here. The Living Greyhawk Campaign is a core rules campaign and as such it uses the most current printing of the rulebooks as its basis. This currently consists of the revised version of these books.

217590.name: Illimat: The Crane Wife Expansion
217590.description: This expansion includes six new Luminaries and two okus tokens inspired by 'The Crane Wife,' along with a box to hold all your Luminaries.

217591.name: Play More: Free D&D v.3.5 Accessory Update Player's Handbook, Dungeon Master's Guide, Monster Manual
217591.description:
From the introduction:

The purpose of this booklet is not to provide a comprehensive list of everything that has changed with the 3.5 revision. The changes are too large in number and varied in scope to be able to provide an all-inclusive inventory. Instead, what we want to do is to show you a broad picture of what has changed and to provide you with support for updating our most popular product.

217592.description:
