The changes are too large in number and varied in scope to be able to provide an all-inclusive inventory. Instead, what we want to do is to show you a broad picture of what has changed and to provide you with support for updating our most popular product.

217596.name: Play More: Free D&D v.3.5 Accessory Update Monster Manual II
217596.description:
From the introduction:

The purpose of this booklet is not to provide a comprehensive list of everything that has changed with the 3.5 revision. The changes are too large in number and varied in scope to be able to provide an all-inclusive inventory. Instead, what we want to do is to show you a broad picture of what has changed and to provide you with support for updating our most popular product.

217598.name: Eclectica
217598.description:
Eclectica is a word-based game for two or more players. Teams compete to decipher clues, get words, and phonetically rearrange them to find answers. The first team to identify the correct answer wins the point!​​

Clues are based on all subjects - ranging from art to mathematics to idioms in the English language - so there’s plenty of room for everyone to play!

217599.name: Tanks: Soviet Lend Lease M10
217599.description: The Lend-Lease program saw thousands of tanks supplied to the Soviet Union during the war. Amongst these were a small number of M10 tank destroyers that somehow found their way to the Eastern Front. While not as heavily armed or armored as some Soviet designs, the turret meant it was one of the few self-propelled guns that could not easily be outflanked.

217600.name: Augmented Reality
217600.description:
The Holistic City Kit for Cyberpunk Roleplaying Games

Publisher's blurb:

Enhance your games of the dark future, with the easy to use Augmented Reality cyberpunk city kit. Inside, you’ll find over 50 tables designed to assist gamesmasters who need to improvise futuristic city details, or who have found that they are unprepared for where their players are heading.

217602.name: Sanctum Secorum (Issue #20 - Jan 2017)
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

217603.name: Charms: A Game of Insight
217603.description:
Description from the publisher:

Charms is a fun, easy to learn party game where each player takes a turn as the Quester by asking a question from the Quest Cards (or their own question). Everyone else finds their inner sage and tries to write the wisest answer based on the Quester's roll of the charms, their meanings, and where they land on the board. The Quester then picks the winning answer. The player with the most winning answers wins the game.

Understand the game in 4 basic steps.

1. Draw a card, read a question to the group, and roll 9 random charms onto the board. Remove "out of play" charms.

2. Use the KEY CARD to review charm meanings. Other players quickly write an answer to your question based on the charms, where they landed on the board, and what this could mean for you.

3. The answers are read aloud. You pick the one that best answers your question, and the author is revealed as the winner of the round.

4. Pass the charms to the left and play again until everyone has asked a question. The player who writes the most winning answers is crowned the Charms Champion of Insight!

217604.description: Enamelled metal eagles based on the Black Box edition cover were produced to support Cambridge Games Factory's Kickstarter campaign. They can be used as a replacement for the leader card.
217604.name: Glory to Rome: Leader Token

217605.name: Ran ans Beet!
217605.description:
Does the stupidest farmer have the biggest potatoes? Not in this game! This is because the clever cultivation of beds, which is about the meaningful juxtaposition (mixed culture, plant friendliness) and succession (fruit sequence), leads to a sumptuous harvest and thus to win the game.
Gameplay: Players systematically grow vegetables, fruit and herbs. They plant according to the garden calendar and promote the growth of their plants. However, a lot has to be taken into account. Are they low or flat rooted, weak, medium or heavy consuming? Does the plant have a long or short growth period? In addition, weather caprioles, beneficial insects and pests, the neighbor or other imponderables can influence the tranquil gardener life.
Game objective: The players try to "harvest" as many self-planted as also by other players placed plant cards. Whoever has the greatest harvest yields is the winner of the game.

217606.name: Heroes: 1st Generation
217606.description:
User summary:

Provides numerous pre-generated characters for the game, each suitable for print-and-play use.

217607.name: Strange Nations: A Worldbuilding Resource
217607.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Strange Nations is a collection of more than thirty cultures ready to be dragged and dropped into your world, with cultures appropriate for every kind of setting from high fantasy to contemporary horror to space opera. While each entry has certain setting assumptions, there are also suggestions for adapting them to other genres.

Here is the city-state of Iditt, where necromancy is an accepted cornerstone and self-mummification is the first step to repaying your lifelong debt to society. Here are the Balas, whose buildings hang off the edge of a flat world. Here are werejaguars, mad fairy refugees, and wagon-drivers with a religious injunction against touching the ground.

This book also holds a wealth of information on other subjects useful to a worldbuilder.

217608.description:
Using the Napoleonic version of the March into Battle system, this game portrays the Battle of Quatre Bras in a furious, fast moving three turn game. Part of a group of mini-games on the battles of the Waterloo campaign, with Ligny and La Belle Alliance.

In this system, units not just take physical losses but will become ineffective from fatigue and disorder long before they run out of men - unless you, in command, can manage them effectively and maintain their edge.

Map scale: 1km per hex
Unit scale: divisions, 1000 men per strength point
Time scale: 3.5 hours per turn
217608.name: Quatre Bras

217610.name: Permafrost
217610.description:
From publisher blurb:

An experiment gone wrong transformed a mild mannered scientist into a dynamo of super powered cold. The mishap also twisted his mind as he now sees his new powers as motive and means to continue his twisted research as Permafrost!

217611.name: QuiVr
217611.description:
User Summary

QuiVr is the defining archery experience.

217612.name: My Horse Prince
217612.description:
User Summary

My Horse Prince has you play as a nameable female protagonist whom meets a male horse (named Yuuma) and becomes its owner, eventually going on to romance him and become his jockey.

217613.name: Loony Lander
217613.description:
User Summary
Land your lunar module on the platform, avoid hitting clouds and other obstacles.

217614.name: Witchcraft
217614.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This magic system is focused, like most RPG magic systems, on a list of magical effects that are in practice organized into spells, with the option to create more. It diverges from the usual in that it has been structured to feel more akin to witchcraft or folk magic than to the Vancian wizardry most traditional in RPGs.

217615.name: Master Mariner
217615.description:
From cassette inlay
A GRAPHIC TRADING GAME FOR THE 48K SPECTRUM
You are the proud owner of the "Titan Trader", sailing around
the coast of Britain buying and selling goods wherever you
dock. Unfortunately, with the crew demanding more wages, your
cargo worth less than you paid for it and pirates off the
port bow, life is not easy for the Master Mariner.
AN EXCITING TRADING GAME TO PLAY OVER AND OVER AGAIN!

217616.name: Castle Zenopus
217616.description:
From the introduction:

The Borderlands are specifically a low magic setting where magic is rare, low powered, and unique. Here is to be discovered the great sword Naril; and the wonderous Heart of Nekron, a great ruby on a gold chain that grants immortality.

217619.description:
In Sherlook, players examine two nearly identical images that have only minor differences between them. Everyone uses their powers of perception to determine how many anomalies there are before the other players can. The faster they can figure it out, the more points they earn — assuming they're right!

Sherlook contains forty images, each with only slight differences from one another, so that players can return to the scene of the crime again and again.
217619.name: Sherlook
boardgamepodcastepisode: #46: Ethnos six-pack review; Blood Rage on tap; CMON Expo round-up

217620.name: Dies Illa: Act I
217620.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dies Illa is a GM-less adventure game where you battle the forces of Hell!

It’s a 20-teens indie tabletop RPG’s take on a 90’s videogame’s take on a 80’s tabletop RPG that’s based on John Harper’s Breakers.

Included are rules and a campaign module. The rules are brief and simple: fill in your stats, choose skills, grab some adventuring gear, and you’re off!

The game is quick and immersive! Each full-color spread details a level and challenges. You fight your foes, racing the clock, and shamelessly loot your fallen foes along the way!

Will you defeat the army of the damned or will the world perish in flames?

rpgitemversion: Hub and Spokes (Free PDF version / Quickstarter)
217622.name: Burning Wheel Gold: Hub and Spokes
217622.description: Free PDF of the first 74 pages of Burning Wheel Gold. Distrubited by Burning Wheel as a playable quick start version.

217623.name: Of Varsks and Winter Witches
217623.description:
From the introduction:

An Adventurer's Guild Scenario set in the heartless wastes of the Birthright Campaign World.

User summary:

Uses resources presented in Tribes of the Heartless Waste.

217624.name: Vale of the Dragon Oracle
217624.description:
From the introduction:

An Adventurer's Guild Tournament set in the Forgotten Realms Campaign Setting.

User summary:

Uses resources presented in FOR8: Cult of the Dragon.

This scenario was subsequently re-published in TSR JAM 1999.

217625.name: The Menagerie
217625.description:
From the introduction:

An Adventurer's Guild scenario using the Planescape Monstrous Compendium Appendix.

User summary:

Uses resources presented in Monstrous Compendium Planescape Appendix.

217626.name: Final Exam
217626.description:
From the introduction:

An Adventurer's Guild scenario featuring the College of Wizardry.

User summary:

Uses resources presented in College of Wizardry.

217627.name: Marooned on Jakandor: Island of War
217627.description:
Knorrman Steel

From the introduction:

Many seasons have passed since the War Mother destroyed the world and made it anew to test Her chosen people, the Knorr. Many harvests and hunts since the strangers, the Allies, first came to the people and brought with them their wicked ways of fiery drink and paper treaties. Theirs was not the way of honorable combat and rights of arms; they brought the evil of false words and hired swords.

User summary:

Uses resources presented in Jakandor: Island of War.

217628.name: Leviathan's Deep
217628.description:
From the introduction:

An Adventurer's Guild Dragonlance: Fifth Age Tournament.

User summary:

Uses resources presented in Heroes of Hope.

This scenario was subsequently re-published in TSR JAM 1999.

217629.name: The Fallen Archmage
217629.description:
From the introduction:

An Adventurer's Guild Arcane Age: Cormanthyr Tournament set in the Forgotten Realms Campaign Setting.

User summary:

Uses resources presented in Cormanthyr: Empire of the Elves.

217630.name: Return of the Pick-Axe
217630.description:
From the introduction:

An RPGA Adventurer's Guild Tournament set in a distant corner of the Greyhawk campaign world.

User summary:

Uses resources presented in Return of the Eight.

This scenario subsequently was republished in TSR JAM 1999.

217631.name: The Manxome Foe
217631.description:
From the introduction:

An RPGA Adventurer's Guild Tournament in the Planescape setting.

User summary:

Uses resources presented in Tales from the Infinite Staircase.

This scenario subsequently was republished in TSR JAM 1999.

217632.name: Blood Feud
217632.description:
From the introduction:

An RPGA Adventurer's Guild Tournament using the AD&D Monstrous Arcana supplement Illithiad.

User summary:

Uses resources presented in The Illithiad.

This scenario subsequently was republished in TSR JAM 1999.

217633.name: Contact
217633.description: In Contact, players take turns as the Spy whose goal is to keep their chosen word secret. They reveal the first letter of their secret word to begin the round. Other players take turns interrogating/asking a question of the Spy who must truthfully answer, thus revealing what the secret word is not in the process. Their answers must also begin with the revealed letter(s). If a question stumps the Spy the other players may Contact the Interrogator to provide their answer. If the answers are the same then the Spy reveals the next letter in their secret word, thus making it harder to keep their word secret.

217634.name: Pyramids of Brass
217634.description:
From the introduction:

An RPGA Adventurer's Guild Dragonlance: Fifth Age Tournament.

User summary:

Uses resources presented in Wings of Fury.

217635.name: Folds in the Tapestry
217635.description:
From the introduction:

An RPGA Adventurer's Guild Tournament set in the Alternity game.

User summary:

Uses resources presented in Alternity Player's Handbook.

This scenario subsequently was republished in TSR JAM 1999.

217636.name: Pivot Pilot
217636.description:
Pivot Pilot is a challenging platformer with puzzle elements in which you take simultaneous control of a boy and a giant robot arm.

Source: The Developer Website.

217637.name: Arena Hero
217637.description:
User Summary

Fight through waves of unique enemies and evolving levels.

217638.name: Gadget & The Gadgetinis
217638.description:
User Summary

A 3D platform game based on the TV series which was a spin-off of the original Inspector Gadget series.

217639.name: Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer
217639.description:
User Summary

A collection of 4 mini-games with a Christmas theme, based on the TV special.

217640.name: We Wish You a Merry Christmas
217640.description:
User Summary

A collection 13 Christmas themed mini-games.

217643.name: Nukklerma: Robot Warfare
217643.description:
One year after the plasma nuclear annihilation on Earth, it became clear that there is no rescue in sight and most survivors gave up the last hope. But Elon believes in the salvation of the dead planet and follows an indefinable buzz into drains.

Source: The Developer Website.

217644.description: An expansion to Monikers that is comprised of cards relating to podcasts hosted by Justin, Griffin, and Travis McElroy. These shows include My Brother, My Brother, and Me; The Adventure Zone; Rose Buddies; Shmanners; and Sawbones. It's a limited edition expansion that may only be available through preorders.
217644.name: Monikers: The McElroy Collection

217645.name: 1831 For our freedom and yours: Battle of Grochow
217645.description:
Board wargame 1831 For our freedom and yours: Battle of Grochow represents one of the most famous battles in the history of the Polish army. Players have historical forces and must act, given the historical advantages and limitations of their armies. Also important are factors such as terrain and weather conditions. Of course you can not skip the random factor.

All these aspects are described in rules which are not complicated.

Among the four scenarios it is introductory scenario - attack of Rosen’s IV corps on alder grove. This is the perfect introduction to a large battle. Players have limited forces and learn basic
rules and characteristics of the terrain. Thanks to this, the experience gained can be used in the course of the scenario for the entire battle.

Game mechanics based on random activations. However, the proper marker set reflects a better command structure of the army of Field Marshal Dybicz. Moreover, this solution provides an exciting game in which each side can take the initiative to surprise the enemy.

Three types of weapons: infantry, cavalry and artillery act according to the common rules, but each of them has its own characteristics. Success on the battlefield provides the appropriate use of the advantages of all kinds of weapons at the right moment. This is obviously the goal pursued by both players. Coordination of their own troops, and respond to your opponent moves makes Battle of Grochow a challenging game, even for experienced players.

217646.name: Test of the Tower
217646.description:
From publisher blurb:

Test of the Tower is a companion adventure designed to go along with Folio #2. It is designed in both 1E & 5E formats for characters levels 2-5 and contains the information needed to run a magical excursion in Roslof Keep.

Driven by Molo of the Five Wives, this adventure around a test to determine the membership into the famed Wizard's Conclave. Does the party have what it takes to pass the test, thus gaining them access to much needed resources kept in secret by the Conclave?

217647.name: Atlas Class Freighter
217647.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ships of Clement Sector 17 covers the Atlas-class freighter which is the second most commonly found ship in Clement Sector. Building on the information found in The Clement Sector Core Setting Book, Ships of Clement Sector 17 lovingly details this shipping legend.

Created by Cascadian legend James Lancaster, the Atlas is perhaps his most enduring legacy. The vessel was first used by Lancaster Shipping and, later, by his Cascadia Colonization Authority (before it became a Cascadian government agency). Following Lancaster's voluntary break-up of his shipping company, the Atlas started being used by corporations, governments, and individuals across the sector.

Within these pages, you will find the standard Atlas as well as these popular variants:

Colony Ship - Based on Lancaster's original design to ferry colonists to new worlds in Clement Sector, the Atlas-class Colony Ship is still in use today on the frontier.
Armed Merchantman - Used by some governments as system defense and some corporations as escorts, the Atlas-class Armed Merchantman and its particle beam barbettes pack quite a punch.
Missile Ship - Trading the cargo pods for missile bays, the Atlas-class Missile Ship can form the backbone of a system's defense forces when they cannot afford to build or purchase a warship. Pirates beware!




Ships of Clement Sector 17: Atlas-class Freighter comes complete with beautiful views of the ship. The Atlas is presented with full deckplans and statistics to make your use of our product simple, easy, and fun. In addition, the ship comes with a set of adventure hooks to get your characters right into the action as well as two short stories written by Bradley Warnes.

Though designed specifically with our Clement Sector setting in mind, the Atlas will be at home in any science fiction setting.

217648.name: Demons & Derringers
217648.description:
From publisher blurb:

The city is burning on the inside. Its masters, the gangs that plot the city's future, have the city in a cold, iron grip. They victimize the poor, they use politicians as puppets, and they prey on the souls of mortals.

The Holder's Coffin, Dranac, the Sunless City, whatever you call it. This is demon country. You don't get ahead without playing by demon rules.

Demons & Derringers is an inclusive, high action, fantasy noir setting for Dungeon World. It includes seven place writeups, eight NPCs, ten gangsters, three custom moves, five hot openings to throw your players into the thick of it, and a hellish compendium class. All of this is distributed under a Creative Commons license.

217649.name: Vigilantes of Horror
217649.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vigilantes of Horror- Fated to be a Monstrous Vigilante!

Cursed, cursed creator! Why did I live? Why, in that instant, did I not extinguish the spark of existence which you had so wantonly bestowed? I know not; despair had not yet taken possession of me; my feelings were those of rage and revenge. I could with pleasure have destroyed the cottage and its inhabitants and have glutted myself with their shrieks and misery.

-Frankenstein, Chapter 16, by Mary Shelley (Frankenstein’s Monster)

From the exciting new horror and intrigue supplements, adventure gamers can experience a whole new type of gaming- but why not take it further? Why not adventure as… a monstrous vigilante? Vigilantes of Horror by Aaron Hollingsworth and published by Purple Duck Games brings you great new options for vigilante play in horror settings! In this new product, check out 7 new vigilante archetypes, including; the electrifying Corpseborne (Frankenstein), the savage Loup Garou (Wolfman), the terrifying Mummified (the Mummy), the sinister Podthing (Body Snatchers), aquatic Reefling (Creature from the Black Lagoon), bloodsucking Vampiryst (Dracula) and steadily unstable Vanished (the Invisible Man). Along with these fun archetypes is more useful material for monstrous vigilantes: 9 new social talents, over 60 new vigilante talents, a list of powerful vendettas, and 6 new magically thematic magic items. Get with the fun and get Vigilantes of Horror from the monstrous malcontents at Purple Duck Games, where our games are what you want!

217650.name: Engineer
217650.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ruin character class for use with Castles & Crusades.

217651.name: The Malefactor: Revised & Expanded
217651.description:
From publisher blurb:

Total Party Kill Games is pleased to release THE MALEFACTOR REVISED, a class sourcebook for use with both the Pathfinder and 5E Dungeons & Dragons RPGs.

As one of the most beloved of all the compatible classes by both fans and reviewers, this expanded version now contains twenty additional pages of content and is fully compatible with both game systems, complete with new art and a gorgeous new layout.

“Fate is for those too weak to determine their own destiny.”

- Exerpts from the memoir of Talitha Shadowtongue, Tiefling Doom Herald

Damned fate… cruelest destiny… bad luck… these are philosophical concepts that many know, but few are able to truly explain or prove. If destiny is pre-determined, inevitable and unchangeable, is there any hope for we mortals to set our own paths? What of those that seem to be damned by fate, always at the mercy of a higher power? Is there any hope for us at all?

It is rumored that some mortals can choose their own fate by selecting the correct paths as they walk through life. Others think that all of life’s events are predestined. There are rumors of those who understand fate’s cruel whims and can free themselves and no longer be slaves to that harsh mistress. I can tell you those rumors are true…

I have lived through perils that would kill even the most steeled warriors. I have slain many a fool that thought to prey upon me. I have danced with fate itself, and taken the lead. What was once my misery is now my salvation, and your damnation. I am an accursed, a doomgiver -- I am a Malefactor.

CLASS DESCRIPTION
Some children begin life cruelly afflicted. Soon after birth, they and their families are beset by random misfortune, injury, and loss. Frequently they are abandoned by their communities for being born under an inauspicious sign, or sacrificed to allay curses seemingly brought down by dark Gods. In reality, the birth of these unfortunates was attended by intangible chaos-spirits known as Yla (EE-la). While the Yla are not inherently evil, they are prone to destruction, and ignorant of the pain and misfortune that they cause those whom they bond with. Sages do not know what causes the Yla to seek out an individual, but as of yet, no known spell or prayer can separate them from their chosen. Many afflicted by these spirits live lives of sorrowful destitution, sometimes taking their own lives in misery.

A choice few however, realize that while their affliction cannot be suppressed, it can be commanded. Whether through study or epiphany, these few learn to channel and command the devious spirits that surround them, turning their hardship into a powerful weapon. These few are known collectively as the Malefactori.

In order to preserve their own lives, they willingly bring misfortune and woe to those around them. They are dangerous to their allies and even more so to their adversaries. A Malefactor that has mastered the ability to transfer his own ill fate to others is truly a dangerous opponent...

This sourcebook comes complete with a killer new class and abilities, archetypes, feats, favored class options and the complete stats for the iconic succubus spawned tiefling on the cover -- Talitha Shadowtongue. Enjoy!

217652.name: Lion's Breath Prison
217652.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Triad Series continues with Lion’s Breath Prison. After success against the Order of the Goat troops your next challenge awaits. The spiritual arm of The Triad is known as the Lion’s Breath. With some unfinished business in the form of Marquis Forten, the PCs continue to seek out their quarry. Can they locate the elusive traitor and bring him to justice? This adventure continues to send the party across the fields of Neville!

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a 4-6 adventurers of lower levels and a DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system.

217653.name: Far Horizon
217653.description:
From publisher blurb:

Far Horizon is a Near Future science fiction adventure and spaceship book for Cepheus Engine and for the Classic 2D6 SF roleplaying game that is based on.

It is 2100 AD and the Earth’s Space Development Agency has funded a mission to the outer edge of the Solar System. Pluto and Charon have been explored and human landings have been made for the first time. Now the crew has taken on a new mission to explore Tartarus, a minor planet billions of kilometres from the Sun and one that is a rogue and not native to our Solar System. Tartarus is a passing interstellar traveller and Earth wants the crew of the Far Horizons to be the first humans ever to land on such a mysterious ‘rogue world’. Its irregular trajectory has the scientists on Earth puzzled – and there’s nothing like getting humans on to the surface to solve a puzzle!

This is a scenario that is based, for the most part, on hard science; the Far Horizon is a nuclear thermal rocket, built around a nuclear fission reactor and relying for its internal gravity on rotating spin sections. Further rules and the full background setting for this scenario can be found in the companion Zozer Games book called ORBITAL 2100. However, that book is not necessary for this adventure to be successfully played out. In this book are all the resources, setting material, rules and equipment needed to play out this deep space mission:

The exploratory spacecraft, the DRV Far Horizon, is described in detail and illustrated with comprehensive deckplans.
Tartarus, its dangers and its secrets, are fully explained.
Events and situations to challenge the player characters are presented for the referee.
The format of the scenario is based around a realistic mission of scientific exploration.
Rules for operating this TL 9 spacecraft and its landers.
Rules for the design and use of TL 9 spacesuits.
For referees without a copy of Orbital 2100, twelve pregenerated characters are provided, each one a competent and skilled astronaut.

217654.name: Gnolls
217654.description:
From publisher blurb:

Best-selling DMSGuild author Tony Petrecca is at it again with another book in our popular 5th Edition Races line! This time out... Gnolls!

Gnolls are a horrific predatory race of hyena-like humanoids bent on pillage and destruction. They prey on the weak, using overwhelming odds and fiendish fury to wreak havoc where they may.

Explore the world of 5th Edition Fantasy Gnolls and find out all you need to know to bring these popular brutes out of the bestiary and on to your game table as a playable race.

What does this book have to offer?

Subraces like the Abyssal Gnoll, Clan Gnoll, and the FLIND!
New Weapons such as the flind bar!
Two new magical items, the Howling Flail and Blood Fangs!

217655.name: Archetypes of the Wind Walker
217655.description:
From publisher blurb:

Archetypes of Wintry Madness

The eldritch, the strange, and the weird are often relegated to the domains of villains and NPCs in fantasy, with the good guys being the ones who stand in the way of the dark things that remain just beyond our perception, which we can never truly understand. But sometimes, it can be fun to take on the mantle of the otherworldly, and to embrace the alien terrors of the cosmos. Each installment of Weekly Wonders: Eldritch Archetypes contains five archetypes for eldritch characters—those that are weird, alien, and otherworldly, who don’t fit in with normal society—as well as a cleric domain devoted to a specific mythos entity or race.

For this book, we focus on the Wind Walker, a primal deity of cold, whose voice whispers on the northern winds, driving men to madness, and to consume the flesh of their fellows. Inspired by the legends of the wendigo, the Wind Walker is an unnatural force of corruption, an endlessly-hungering deity of frost and madness. The archetypes in this book build on these themes of hunger, cannibalism, arctic frost, and, of course, the ability to walk the northern winds. This book includes the following archetypes:

The windwalker bloodline, for bloodragers, that draws power from hunger and from eating the corpses of humanoid creatures.
The order of the wendigo, a cavalier archetype whose weapons are rimed with frost, and whose mounts gain the ability to walk the northern winds.
The wendigo kin, a druid archetype that specializes in swallowing her foes alive.
The arctic channeler, a kineticist archetype with access to several unique snow- and ice-themed talents, and the ability to reduce burn through cannibalism.
The caller of the north wind, a skald archetype that can conjure arctic gales and absorb the skills of those whose bodies he consumes.
A bonus cleric domain for those who worship the Wind Walker.

217656.name: The Beast Hack 3
217656.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Beast Hack 3 is the third bestiary for Black Hack by Tricky Troll Games! This volume contains 60 monsters! Old fantasy favorites as well as many originals are included in this book. So prepare yourself for a battle of life and death against some deadly monstrocities!

217657.name: Undead Paragon Classes II: Ghoul, Lich and Mummy
217657.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ever wanted to play an undead? Undead Paragon Classes II introduces three new 1-20 player classes: the Ghoul, Lich and Mummy. These classes provide strong, balanced options for undead players while hitting all of the classics of each monster. Undead Paragon Classes also delivers a 0RP racial template, the Rotting Corpse, which can be added to any other race to make it undead. Why play a dwarf when you can play a rotting dwarf?

Included in Undead Paragon Classes:

The Ghoul, a murderous cannibal who weakens his enemies with disease and paralysis, then feeds on their flesh.
The Lich, an unbridled necromantic spell caster who burns his own soul in pursuit of greater power, and achieves immortality through a phylactery.
The Mummy, a blasphemous servant of the divine who slings curses and infects his enemies with horrific rot.
The Rotting Corpse, a 0RP racial template that can be added to any other race to make them undead (From Undead Paragon Classes I).
17 Undead Feats, such as Bloody, Remove Head, and Grave Rider (From Undead Paragon Classes I).
Raise Undead, a new spell that allows for transformation into an undead creature (From Undead Paragon Classes I).

217658.name: Hearthstone: Goblins vs Gnomes
217658.description:
Goblins vs Gnomes (often abbreviated as GvG) is the first expansion for Hearthstone: Heroes of Warcraft, released on December 8th 2014 in the Americas region, and on 9th/10th December in other regions. The second infusion of new cards to be added to the game, the expansion features 123 collectible cards, with a strong mechanical theme, and introduced the Mech minion type, as well as debuting the long-awaited spectator mode.

Source: The Game Website.

217659.name: Hearthstone: The Grand Tournament
217659.description:
The Grand Tournament is the second expansion to Hearthstone: Heroes of Warcraft, featuring 132 collectible cards, as well as 17 uncollectible cards. The expansion was released August 24, 2015, shortly after 10am PDT/7pm CEST.

Source: The Game Website.

217660.name: Hearthstone: Whispers of the Old Gods
217660.description:
Whispers of the Old Gods is Hearthstone's third expansion, launched April 26th, 2016. Featuring 134 new collectible cards, this sinister expansion revolves around the dark influence of the Old Gods, ancient and unspeakably evil creatures that have long lain hidden, imprisoned in the dark places of the world millennia ago. Despite their imprisonment, these shadowy beings' influence can be felt in every corner of Azeroth, twisting and corrupting any who hear their maddening whispers. With an army of followers performing forbidden empowerment rituals, the tentacles of these massive horrors are growing rapidly toward the light, eager to bring their own kind of excitement to the sunlit kingdoms and merry taverns of Azeroth

Source: The Game Website.

217661.name: Hearthstone: Mean Streets of Gadgetzan
217661.description:
Released December 1, 2016, Hearthstone's fourth expansion, Mean Streets of Gadgetzan, features 132 new collectible cards. Set in the bustling, lawless port city of Gadgetzan, the expansion features characters from the city's three ruling crime families - the brutish Grimy Goons, the assassins of the Jade Lotus, and the shadowy spellcasters of the Kabal. With their own minions, spells and weapons, each family is formed from an allegiance of three different Hearthstone classes, resulting in multi-class cards, usable by heroes of any of those three classes.

Source: [Mean Streets of Gadgetzan The Game Website].

217662.name: Revolution D100 SRD
217662.description:
From publisher blurb:

And at last... the Revolution D100 System Reference Document is ready!

Revolution D100 is the new in-house system for D100 RPGs published by Alephtar Games. Successfully crowdfunded in late 2015, the game is now entering its alst production stage and we can finally show its core to the public.

217663.name: Revolution D100
217663.description:
From publisher blurb:

This game proposes a new approach to percentile-based role-playing games, while keeping the unique flavour of classic D100. In the book you will find: class-less and skill-based character generation; an intuitive percentile resolution method; lethal combat; supernatural powers; and many more of the hallmarks which made D100 games so popular.

This game also features:

Native multi-genre support: play fantasy, steampunk, historical, cyberpunk, space opera and more.

A new approach to the percentile die that does not require calculations.

Distinct roles for characteristics and skills.

Streamlined system to run all significant events as extended conflicts.

Basic combat based on conflict rules, for when violence is not the main course

Optional advanced combat with greater level of detail, for when the clash of steel is important.

Basic power list with countless possibilities for customization.
Four sample power types: Arcane Magic, Divine Magic, Psionics and Weird Science.

Do-it-yourself system for designing weapons and armour, both historical and hi-tech.

Rules for character-created gadgetry and potions, as well as enchantments.

An introductory scenario, The Quest for El Dorado

217665.name: The Sundial
217665.description:
Theme
As a captain on your own vessel, you sail your ship to the Mediterranean following actual routes, namely those of the Swedish Orient Line. Circumstances sometimes force you to change your course. It may be expensive, but it may also be profitable. Whatever the cost, you have to return to and complete your route: that is something neccessitated by the service. In the Mediterranean and Black Sea ports you also act as business man and buyer. You may have successful business – and you may meet with difficulties – while buying the goods you will carry to Sweden or some other Northern European country. With a little concentration and some good luck – here as in reality the risks may be reduced and possibilitis of profit increased.

Gameplay
Players engage as a ship's master and take turns to roll two dices to move their ship along different paths in the mediterranean. Each player must aquire 5000 tons of cargo divided into five different goods (1000 tons each) from the harbours around the mediterranean. Players also sail during different seasons of the year and the goods requirement will differ (e.g. one player needs raisins, oranges, nuts, cotton, and tobaco while others need other goods). The types of goods are spread out at different ports and as only half of the requirement for each product can be loaded at the same port, the players will need to visit more than five ports to fulfill their requirements (with some exceptions). The game becomes a task of route optimization to visit the neccessary ports with the least number of dice rolls. Along the way sailors run the risk of encountering storms, price changes on the goods exchange, and random events received via telegram. When all goods have been aquired the players must sail back to Sweden and sell the cargo in Gothenburg and Stockholm (half in each) according to current prices on the goods exchange. The first player to finished selling all their goods ends the game.

Goal
The player with the biggest fortune in cash and goods at game end wins the game. Goods still on the ship will be worth according to current prices on the goods exchange, however, players that have not returned to Sweden will lose money for each product missing from their required goods.

Background
The "Sundial" was released by Alga in 1958 during a jubilee for Broströms shipping company.

217666.description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.

There are also chance cards which may help or hinder you. The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks - but there are some options in this pack.

There are 36 possible mountain railway excursions which give you extra points and a big bonus for the most trips.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: combined points for two journeys: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn extra points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
217666.name: Myanmar (fan expansion of Ticket to Ride)

217667.description:
This Hero Set contains five all new Heroes to join the ranks of the Deep Lords.

Captain: Triton
Brute: The Elder Below
Gunner: Euryale
Quartermaster: Tick Tock
Swashbuckler: Spyridon
217667.name: Rum & Bones: Deep Lords Heroes Set #1

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
217668.name: Tales of the North: The Raiding Party (OSRIC Version)
217668.description:
Publisher blurb:

Raiding Party is an old school OSRIC compatible module designed for a party of 6-8 1st level characters. The module should bring characters up to 3rd level.

It can be easily slipped in as the beginning of a campaign. Raiding Party is an action oriented adventure set on the wild border of civilization.

Trouble is brewing on the borders of civilization. Humanoid raiding parties threaten the scattered settlements of humanity. Can you stop the raiding parties and uncover what is behind them?

217669.description:
This Hero Set contains five all new Heroes to join the ranks of the Deep Lords.

Captain: Don Juan
Brute: Felicia
Gunner: Cabo Morales
Quartermaster: Senor Espadero
Swashbuckler: Renaldo Guitarra
217669.name: Rum & Bones: Marea de la Muerte Heroes Set #1

217670.description:
Sea Monsters Box contains resculpted miniatures for the sea monsters available in the base game (Sea Dragon and Kraken) and three new monsters.

The new monsters are:
Siren
Avatar of Poseidon
Shell Cracker
217670.name: Rum & Bones: Sea Monsters

217671.name: Mag-O-Mag
217671.description:
Mag-O-Mag features an innovative vertical holder with interchangeable game boards and magnetic game pieces that allows you to play three fun, action-packed games. The games are played in teams, playing one at a time. One teammate must move the guide magnet on the backside of the game board, while the other teammate sees the game magnet move on the front of the board. This teammate must communicate with the one controlling the magnet and tell them how to move the magnet to complete the game challenge without the magnet falling off or going to the wrong spot.

In the racing game, the object is speed: Which team can complete the course fastest — while making sure you don’t crash!

In the golf game, the object is precision: How many strokes does the team need to take to reach the hole? Traps await everywhere!

In the treasure hunt game, players must collect as many gems as possible in a given time. Who can amass the most valuable treasure?

Mag-O-Mag includes cooperative game variations and special rules for two-player games.

217672.name: Lifeline: Silent Night
217672.description:
User Summary

Lifeline: White Out is a text based real-time storytelling adventure game.

217673.name: Lifeline: Whiteout
217673.description:
User Summary

Lifeline: Whiteout is a text based real-time storytelling adventure game. The survival theme begins at a frozen crash site and evolves from there.

217674.name: Lifeline: Crisis Line
217674.description:
User Summary

Lifeline: Crisis Line is a text based real-time storytelling adventure game. This episode focuses on sleuthing and tough decisions.

217675.name: Lifeline: Flatline
217675.description:
User Summary

Lifeline: Flatline is a text based real-time storytelling adventure game. This episode take a turn well into survival horror territory.

217676.name: Lifeline: Halfway to Infinity
217676.description:
User Summary

Lifeline: Halfway to Infinity is a text based real-time storytelling adventure game. This episode continues the story of Taylor from the original Lifeline game.

217678.name: Paw Patrol: Sports Day Challenge Path Game
217678.description: Players choose one of three pups (Chase, Marshall, or Skye) and take turns racing along a path. A spinner determines the distance moved. Certain squares along the path earn the player trophies (points), or send a player backwards a short distance. Along the way, players choose to take a longer and safer path, or a shorter path that risks giving their trophies to the player with the least amount. Players that reach the finish line earn an additional trophy on their turn. The game ends when the last pup crosses the finish line.

217679.name: Triumph of the Will: Nazi Germany vs. Imperial Japan, 1948
217679.description:
Description from the publisher:

This game allows two players to game an alternate history where Germany and Japan have won WWII. Three years after that victory in 1948 they square off against each other for a final battle for world domination. The map of the game joins along the equator to depict the entire world.

Game mechanics recreate dilemmas and challenges inherent in grand-strategic warfare and the issues involved with controlling the entire planet. Movement switches rapidly back and forth between players keeping you fully involved in the game with no long waits between players. In any order you want, you can: enter reinforcements; bring back into play previously eliminated units; move an army, air force, fleet or elite corps on the map via land, sea or air; launch a conventional attack or launch a nuclear attack. Both conventional and nuclear attack options are available to players.

Complexity: Medium
Time Scale: Varies 1yr/turn
Map Scale: Global Area Movement
Unit Scale: Armies/Fleets/Air Forces

217680.name: Mexican Standoff
217680.description:
In Mexican Standoff, the players — western heroes that they are — aim to take as many tricks as possible during the eleven rounds of the game, in addition to collecting as many points as possible.

Unlike most games, lower-valued cards are worth more as the deck contains fewer of them. The players can challenge each other, as well as the sheriff, to a duel. After a duel, only one player is left standing, and this player takes several tricks at the same time. The final winner is the player who fights a duel at the most appropriate time and collects the largest sum of dollars as well as the highest number of special bandit cards.

217681.name: UNO: DC SuperHero Girls
217681.description:
Description from the publisher:

It's the fun and fast-paced game you love, now featuring your favorite DC Super Hero Girls! Players race to get rid of all their cards by matching a card in their hand with the current card shown on top of the deck and in this version, there's a special wild card with new DC Super Hero Girls rule and two customizable wild cards. Maybe you'll draw the Save the Day card! That lets you make another player immune from penalty cards until another wild card is played. Score points by being the first to get rid of all the cards in your hand. First player or team to 500 wins. When you're down to one card, don't forget to yell "UNO!" Contains 112 cards plus instructions. For 2 to 10 players, ages 7 and older. Easy to pick up, impossible to put down.

217682.name: Dogs Night Out: Poker School
217682.description:
Description from the publisher:

Get ready for a thinking player's game. Dogs Night Out Poker School will not only make you think about your plays, but you will have fun leaving your money off the table. Whether you are new to Texas Holdem or a long time player, your're going to gain an understanding of the game that you have never had before. Gambling is not required.

Two complete games! OUT CARD (the more challenging game) and FIVE BALL POKER (the simpler game). Play with friends, teach friends, play solo. No Matter how you choose to play, you will continuously be improving the game.

Out Card
An entertaining, innovative approach using a combination of tools to analyze a poker game. A visual representation of a poker hand makes it easier to see winning possibilities. Numbering Out Cards in priority order is a challenge that will improve your poker game. This game can be played with friends as a challenge or teaching tool, or play solo for individual learning.

5 Ball Poker
Learn to analyze the top current and best potential hands at five different analysis points represented by Pool balls in a street map format. A simple, yet important tool for your poker game, showing the road to the money hand.

217683.name: The Heart's Final Beat
217683.description:
From the introduction:

A Ravenloft adventure for the Adventurer's Guild Retail Play Program.

User summary:

Uses resources presented in Champions of the Mists.

This scenario was subsequently re-published in TSR JAM 1999.

217684.name: A Second Chance
217684.description:
From the introduction:

A Ravenloft/World of Greyhawk cross-over adventure for the Adventurer's Guild Retail Play Program.

User summary:

This scenario uses resources presented in Vecna Reborn.

217685.name: Ill Omens
217685.description:
From the introduction:

The life of an adventurer is not always fun and gold, sometimes it's bleak. For Theron Sternwood and friends, life has taken a turn for the worse. When their fortunes are told, they discover they have no future. Turning to the Temple of Istus and the goddess of divination for help they find their fate in jeopardy for the "Voice of Istus" has grown silent in death. They must find the former "Voice of Istus" and get her to take up her duties again if they are to have a future. But to win back their lives, the heroes must seek misfortune in the hidden temple of Ralishaz, the god of ill chance.

Ill Omens presents a prelude to the new The Lost Tombs adventure series predicting that doom lies on the horizon for Greyhawk. But here, too, are clues to how that future may be avoided, and there are clues about the dangers the heroes will face in the coming days.

User summary:

This scenario uses resources presented in The Adventure Begins.

217686.name: Special Delivery
217686.description:
From the introduction:

A Forgotten Realms Adventure set in the city of Ravens Bluff for the Adventurer's Guild Retail Play Program.

User summary:

This scenario uses resources presented in The City of Ravens Bluff.

217687.name: Caravan
217687.description:
From the introduction:

The first Living City tournament.

User summary:

This scenario uses resources presented in The City of Ravens Bluff.

217688.name: At Last, Ravens Bluff
217688.description:
From the introduction:

The second Living City tournament.

User summary:

This scenario uses resources presented in The City of Ravens Bluff.

217689.name: Counterfeit Dreams
217689.description:
From the introduction:

The third Living City tournament.

User summary:

This scenario uses resources presented in The City of Ravens Bluff.

217690.name: Bloody Jack
217690.description:
From the back of the book:

All the children of the Blight know the nursery rhymes about Bloody Jack Carver, cautionary tales for naughty or overly inquisitive children to mind their manners and obey their parents. However, their parents know the true horror of those times 30 years ago when the lunatic serial killer known as Bloody Jack Carver stalked the fog-shrouded streets of the Blight and abducted children. The killing spree finally ended, but the perpetrator was never caught.

When the PCs are deputized to assist in a homicide investigation, they find terrifying clues that point to the three-decade-old Bloody Jack killings and signs to indicate that they were just the beginning. Now the PCs are in a race against time across the breadth of the decrepit and deteriorating city that is the Blight as they attempt to stop a new killing spree before it can start. The PCs’ investigation takes them from the halls of the Capitol and the seedy streets and alleys of Toiltown to the garish carnival piers of Festival and the pollutant-crusted banks of the Great Lyme River. Only they stand between the children of this decayed city and new nursery rhymes being written in their blood.

Bloody Jack is a stand-alone adventure set in the Blight for 4–6 5th-level characters.

217691.name: Downunder the Living City
217691.description:
From the introduction:

The fifth Living City tournament.

User summary:

This scenario uses resources presented in The City of Ravens Bluff.

217692.name: Day of the Raven
217692.description:
From the introduction:

The sixth Living City tournament.

User summary:

This scenario uses resources presented in The City of Ravens Bluff.

217693.name: The Curse of Red Death
217693.description:
From the introduction:

The eighth Living City tournament.

User summary:

This scenario uses resources presented in The City of Ravens Bluff.

217694.name: The Throne of Huangdi
217694.description:
From the introduction:

An Adventure for the Marvel Super Heroes Adventure Game Designed Especially for the Adventurer's Guild RPGA Program.

User summary:

This scenario uses resources presented in Marvel Super Heroes Adventure Game.

217695.name: Salvage
217695.description:
From the introduction:

An RPGA Adventurer's Guild Tournament set in the Alternity game.

User summary:

This scenario uses resources presented in Star*Drive Campaign Setting.

217697.name: Avalon Hazards 1
217697.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need to add a bit of a challenge to your games, well Avalon is here to help out. This series of hazard for the Pathfinder game system will offer your players a brief bit of fun and excitement, a challenge that they will have to face and overcome.

Bring your players to their knees and add some fun to your game with Avalon Hazards.

217698.name: Avalon Lairs: The Shining King of the Sewers
217698.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need a side adventure to fill out your game, or something to get things going. You find you are hard pressed to come up with a fun adventure or location for your group this week. Well Avalon Games is here to help.

Avalon Lairs offers s short Pathfinder adventure for you to run your players through. A full adventure featuring a lair of some type of creature, each issue of the series will offer a fully realized adventure, with encounters, locations and maps as needed. Nothing grand and detailed, the adventure is easy use, simple in their design and fast to play.

Let Avalon do all the work for you so you can have more fun running the game. Avalon Lairs is the place to find just that help.

The Lair of the Shining King of the Sewers offers a Ware Rat lair in a dank sewers. Seek out adventure and defeat the king of the Sewers before he drags you down.

217699.name: Looper
217699.description:
From publisher blurb:

Looper is a ring world found out on the Fringe. Inside you will find all the details of the fantastic creatures and dangers that wait explorers of this strange new world.

As a special bonus with this new series of IF Treats, this new series of creatures of the Infinite Creatures series come with their own unique Fringe world (thus allowing for a wider range of environments than are currently cataloged in the populated worlds of the Fringe.) Of course, this in no way means that these creatures must be used with this new world, nor that they even must be used in the Fringe setting. This new Origin World is, instead, intended to be a way of introducing strange and otherworldly sci fi creatures into a campaign within their own unique world with as little need for work from the Gamemaster to make that happen. These oddities come with a world ready made to receive them, a world which can be plopped down ready made into any Infinite Futures campaign.

217700.name: The Phoenix Barony, 2nd Edition
217700.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Nestled uncomfortably between the Gloomwoods and the Black mountains is the remote Phoenix Barony of Baron Marshall…”

The Phoenix Barony is back! This second edition of the Phoenix Barony has been revised for use with Swords & Wizardry White Box, or any old school fantasy RPG.

The Phoenix Barony is a concise, campy, light hearted, fantasy adventure setting written to be easily digested and quickly put to use. The document contains enough information to inspire you and get you going…but not so much that it is unwieldy or will bore you to tears.

Large enough to host a lifetime of adventures, but small enough to fit in a corner of any fantasy world, It’s my hope that many more people enjoy exploring (and developing) this little hex of land.

217701.name: Grimoire Arcana II
217701.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Grimoire Arcana is a much sought after spell book that holds the source of several lost forms of magic. The tome took centuries and loss of many lives to compile. It was torn into two sections decades ago and the two sections hidden in different areas of the realm.

The book you now hold is a copy of the second half of the tome. It holds the secrets to five different forms of magic. The knowledge of these forms of magic will change anyone forever.

The forms of magic in this partial of the great tome are: Illusion Magic, Plant Magic, Sand Magic, Sound Magic and Thievery Magic.

Includes 90 magic spells in a 32 page PDF.

217702.name: Mind Games: A Singularity System Module
217702.description:
From the back of the book :

Harness the Power of the Mind

Inside the Mind Games module, you will find :
* Rules for psionic powers in the singularity system - 50 unique Psionic Talents!
* New Skills, Perks and Weaknesses to enhance your Singularity campaign.
* Psionic-powered weapons, items, and implants.

217705.name: Szyfr Pana Twardowskiego
217705.description:
Szyfr Pana Twardowskiego is a simple roll and move racing game designed as promotional material by Bydgoszcz City Hall (Polish city).
Game apart from simple roll and move mechanic uses trivia card with questions related to Bydgoszcz (architecture, geography, history, etc).

217708.name: Age of Wonders III: Eternal Lords
217708.description:
Eternal Lords introduces the Tigran and Frostling races and the new Necromancer class.

Players must adapt to a world on the brink of cataclysmic change. New mechanics such as the Race Governance system, which allows players to tailor the features of each race in their empire to meet their strategic needs, add new layers of depth to empire development and diplomacy. Embrace forbidden powers and reign for eternity!

Source: The Publisher Website.

217709.description: In the First Hero Expansion, players take the role of 4 veteran survivors who have no settlement to call their own. They find and invade a settlement where they face the First Hero, a survivor so powerful, they do all the hunting by themselves! The purpose of this expansion is to help players start more advanced campaigns at Lantern Year 12 or 20. Instead of simply providing complicated rules to generate later settlements, your showdown with the First Hero will create the advanced settlement that you can take over.
217709.name: Kingdom Death: Monster – First Hero Expansion

217710.name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Abyssal Woods Expansion
217710.description:
The Abyssal Woods campaign, of course has an Abyssal Woods Campaign! It's fully devloped re-imaging of the People of Bloom campaign in the Flower Knight Expansion!

Develop a civilization in the Abyssal Woods! Worship the Flower Knight. Battles Disciples of the Witch! Hunt the Dragon Goblin, Confront the Flower Witch! Craft awesome armor, roll around Spider Balls and more!!!

In addition to the Core Game. You'll need:
Flower Knight expansion
Spidicules Expansion.

The Dung Beetle Knight and Honeycomb Weaver expansions have optional special interactions with the Campaing too!

217711.description:
The Ivory Dragon extends your campaign by 5 years, establishing a final new threat after the Gold Smoke Knight. It gives the players an avenue to use their experience with the Gold Smoke Knight for further development and gear.

Contains:
1 x 20-30+ pages rulebook
1 x Ivory Dragon miniature (135mm base)
1 x Gate Guardian (50mm base)
2 x White/Ivory Dragon Armor miniatures
2 x Hybrid Gate Guardian + Lantern miniatures
2 x Gold Smoke Knight Armor miniatures
80+ x game cards
1 x Settlement Event cards
60 x gear cards
217711.name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Ivory Dragon

217712.name: Interval Spellcasting
217712.description:
From publisher blurb:

For the Pathfinder RPG customer who wants a little more, Everyman Gaming is proud to introduce Everyman Minis! Uniting several high-quality Pathfinder RPG freelancers under a single product line, each week a different Everyman Gaming author or freelancer tackles an exciting new topic by creating a miniature product specially designed to scratch that product’s particle itch.

This installment of Everyman Minis includes: 1,000 words discussing interval magic—a variant spell casting system that provides spell casters with special benefits and abilities determined by the time of day.

217713.name: Nightmare Forest: Udder Terror
217713.description:
Description from the publisher:

The Aliens are here and they need to collect a small herd of cows for investigation and cultivation. You and your alien friend have decided to make it a competition to see who can get the most cows.

The cows are laid out in a 4x4 grid and the players each taking turns looking at 2 of the face down cards and deciding if they want to put them back in the space they came from or swap them. Then they lay down one of their tractor beam cards (power 1-8) face down along their 2 sides of the pasture.

Once all tractor beams are placed they are flipped over and then the aliens compare the power of their combined 2 tractor beam cards that are at the end of each of the row and columns that meet at each cow.

The highest power combination wins the cow. Tied spaces causes the cow to be vaporized.

Quick fun game for 2 players in 6-9 minutes.

217715.name: Dicecapades! 2nd Edition Expansion Pack: Kids
217715.description:
Description from the publisher:

Dicecapades! 2nd Edition is the same great game as the original version but now with more cards! Think you can stack dice on your face? Will you dominate in arm wrestling? How about obscure facts? With a mixture of dice games, physical challenges, artistic creations, and trivia questions that will exercise both sides of your brain, you'll see why DICEcapades isn’t just the luck of the dice - it’s the smarts of the roller!

Need more cards? No problem, get the DICEcapades Expansion Packs. Each expansion pack comes with 45 new cars to boost your Dicecapades! 2nd Edition game.

Expansion pack 1 is kids themed and includes 45 more cards for Dicecapades! 2nd Edition game.

217716.name: Vauhtia ja vipinää
217716.description:
Throw dice and go from water lily leaf to another and a frog shows how the body whirl. Stretching, balancing, jumping and various dynamic conditions are important for the development of the growing child.

Spinner surprise by accelerating or slowing down the going onwards on leaves.

Include: 18 track tiles, die, spinner and four frogs pawns.

217717.name: Demon Hunter 3: Revelation
217717.description:
Having defeated the Beast from another dimension, Dawn Harlock had hoped to spend the rest of her life in peace. However, circumstances have placed the life of a child at stake and brought her out of retirement to once again solve supernatural riddles and hunt hellish demons. Can the world’s foremost paranormal detective muster the courage to follow the dark path and face off against an enemy from beyond? With you as her guide, she stands a chance.

CONTINUE THE DARK ADVENTURE SERIES!
The protagonist will once more don her detective hat to investigate a mysterious case.

IMMERSE YOURSELF IN MAGIC AND THE SUPERNATURAL!
A woman was murdered and her daughter disappeared under strange circumstances. Is this a random crime, or is something sinister lurking behind it?

A CAPTIVATING STORY PACKED WITH SECRETS AND RIDDLES!
Dawn slowly starts to suspect that a terrifying force is at work. Indeed, the supernatural events might have more to do with her own mysterious origin than she would have wanted.

TEST YOURSELF IN 26 MINIGAMES AND 21 HIDDEN OBJECT SCENES!
The Demon Huntress will need to find the victim’s daughter before it’s too late. Will she dare to follow the creature from another dimension and delve into dark secrets of her own past?

Source: The Publisher Website.

217718.name: Signature: The Handwriting Analysis Game
217718.description:
This is a small box that contains several tear-off pads of sheets of several types, as well as 48 numbered cards with samples of famous people's handwriting on one side, and three choices as to whom the handwriting is on the opposite side. Also included is a booklet that goes into some detail about how handwriting analysis works, what can (and cannot) be deducted from it, as well as rules for three variants of games that can be played, two of which use the cards included.

FROM THE INSTRUCTIONS:
Handwriting Analysis Games
In addition to providing insights into your own personality, the forgoing tests may also be given to your friends, with you acting as amateur graphologist and analyzing their handwriting, signature, and doodles.
The tests may also be used as a basis for a game of handwriting analysis. This can be done as follows:

1. Players choose one of the four tests and analyze themselves according to the instructions for that test. They check off the results on the appropriate pad sheet.
2. Players initial their pad sheets and pass them to one player who has been selected as reader.
3. Reader shuffles the sheets and reads off, one by one, each player's personality traits. As each sheet is read, ALL players (except the reader) must attempt to guess whose personality traits are being read off.
4. Each correct guess scores one point, and at the end, the player with the highest point count wins.

Introduction to Famous People Games
(Skip some info on separating the cards initially)
On the face of each card are some lines of writing by a famous person. Underneath these lines, in the lower right hand corner, is a series of numbers. These numbers refer to t he personality traits on YOUR PERSONALITY PROFILE pad. They give you an instant analysis of t he writer of the line.
For instance, in the example above, the writing shows traits 9, 17 and 21. Looking at the YOUR RESPONSIBILITY PROFILE pad, you can see that the writer has his head and heart in balance, possesses a dramatic flair, exaggerates and likes to be noticed.
These personality traits are clues to the identity of the person in question. On t he back of each card you will find three famous names. One of them is the writer of the line on the face of the card. Using the personality clues mentioned above - and your intuition - Try to match the lines with their real writer. Answers will be found on page 24.

Famous People Game #1
IN this game, any number of players may compete in identifying the writers of the lines on the front of the Famous People Cards. The Game is played as follows:
1. The deck is shuffled and each player cuts. The player with the highest card (number in the upper left hand corner) deals.
2. Dealer deals one card at a time to center of the table - handwritten lines up.
3. Players have a maximum of one minute to look at the writing and compare the numbers beneath it to the numbered personality traits on their YOUR RESPONSIBILITY PROFILE pad sheets. This gives them some idea of the writer's personality.
4. After one minute, the dealer turns the card over. On the back are the names of three possible writers of the lines on the other side. Players must pick the name of the real writer, using their knowledge of the of the people involved or simple intuition.
5. Players record their answers on a sheet from the FAMOUS PEOPLE GAME pad. As each card is turned over, they write the LETTER (a, b, or c) of the famous person chosen in the box next to the NUMBER of that card.
6. After all 48 cards have been dealt, The dealer reads the answers.
7. Players check off correct answers in appropriate boxes on their FAMOUS PEOPLE GAME pads. Each check scores one point. Highest point total wins.
NOTE: Game may be played as a form of solitaire, with one player turning over cards and attempting to guess as many of the famous writers as possible.

Famous People Game #2
This is a handwriting game for from two to six people.
Players analyze the writing of other players and compare their own handwriting with samples written by famous people. The game is played in the following manner:
1. Players take a sheet from the YOUR RESPONSIBILITY PROFILE pad. They fill in samples of their handwriting, following the instructions on the sheet. Each player then passes his sheet to the player on his left for analysis.
2. Players analyze the handwriting samples, using the instructions. The sheets are then passed back to their writers - with check marks next to the personality traits revealed in their handwriting.
3. One player is appointed dealer. He shuffles the deck and deals one card at a time to center of the table - handwritten lines face up.
4. Players compare the numbers in the lower right hand corner of the card with the numbered personality traits checked off on their YOUR RESPONSIBILITY PROFILE pad sheets. The player with the largest number of matching traits claims the card and places it in the table in front of him.
5. In the case of unmatched cards or ties, the card is considered dead and remains unclaimed in the center of the table.
6. After all 48 cards have been dealt, the player who has been able to claim the most cards is the winner. All players then have an opportunity to see which famous people they most resemble.
7. Players turn over their cards revealing three possible famous writers for each card. The dealer then turns to the answer section below and, taking the cards of each player in turn, announces the names of the famous people whose personalities match his.

217719.name: Elemintary
217719.description:
An unsavoury crime has been committed in Mintsby and you, the amateur sleuth Sherbet Holmes, aided by your dear friend Dr Winegum, are charged with solving the case.
You must move around the randomly generated playing area, search locations and memorise the suspects you encounter.
For, when you have eliminated the innocent, whoever remains, however improbable, must be the culprit.
A glance at your pocket watch shows you only have 12 hours remaining. Come, Winegum, the game is afoot...

The game is a take on a 'find the pairs' memory game. Find the pair of tiles of a suspect to eliminate them from your enquiries.
However, there are also other tiles which can help or hinder your investigation.
And you must solve the case against the clock.
Dice are used to move to and from locations so your choice of where to search may be restricted - fortunately Dr Winegum is there to help you.

Elemintary was an entry in the 2016 Mint Tin Design contest and it did rather well:

2nd place (equal): Best Overall Design
1st place: Best Artwork & Graphic Design
2nd place: Best Written Rules
4th place: Best Theme

217720.name: Naturally Disastrous: Discoverable Items Promo Pack
217720.description:
This promo pack was available during Kickstarter.com campaigns and at conventions. It contains the following:

Cloaking Device- The owner of the device cannot be seen by natives unless they are the only Alien not KO'd or Mutated. If the Yellow Alien is in play, and all other Aliens are KO'd or Mutated, the cloaking device has no effect.

M.R.E. (Microwavable Ready Earth-food)- The Medical officer of the crew figured out that if you Microwave a lemon filled doughnut allows you to heal all your wounds. It is then discarded.

Malfunctioning Transporter- This functions similarly to a transporter but you have to roll the D10 and D8 die to decide where you end up. You can also discard it to move a Native or Mutated Alien instead of an Alien.

217721.name: Temple of the Gith
217721.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A few tendays back, the shifting muds of the Marsh of Chelimber revealed a Gith structure. The citizens of Loudwater and Soubar have heard rumors of both treasure and fierce guardians. After the Gith ruin’s inhabitants are dealt with, the adventurers uncover a Gith puzzle which leads to treasure.

User summary:

For 1st - 4th level characters.

217722.name: Gloom: Bookmark of Death
217722.description:
The playable bookmark "Bookmark of Death" was part of the "Gloom: Digital Edition" kickstarter project.

Description from the kickstarter: Sour friendships and turn the tables with the playable bookmark, usable in a game of physical Gloom.

Bookmark Text:
Front:
During your turn, you may perform wither of the following actions as a free play.
Take one Untimely death card from the discard pile and add it to your hand.
Or...
Discard any number of Untimely Death cards from your hand.

Back:
After using the Bookmark of Death, pass it to the player on your left. Each player may only use the Bookmark of Death once per game.
At the end of the game, it is returned to its original owner.

217723.name: Carry On: Gear Collecting Card Game
217723.description:
Description from the publisher:

Carry On is a gear collecting card game for the end of the world. Players compete to stash food and weapons, and seek aid from other survivors.

Each player starts with a "stash" of four cards. Each turn you can play a card from your stash. Different cards have different Actions. After an Action resolves, replace the card played with the top card from the Draw Pile. However, most Actions allow you to Replenish your stash in several strategic ways.

Different cards/items have different Actions, or rather different items cause different things within the game to happen. Tools like the Compass and Shovel allow players to search the Draw Pile and Discard Pile for a card to replenish their Stash. Weapons, like the Tactical Knife and Hand Gun let you intimidate opponents into giving you cards.

In addition to Items, there are also other Survivors within the deck that can you help you on your quest for survival gear. The Minimalist allows you to discard additional cards. The Pacifist gets rid of your opponents Weapons. The Anarchist let's you straight up steal from your opponent. And The Generalist allows you to swap out cards with an opponent.

To win, be the first player to collect all three pieces of radioactive protective gear - Hazmat Boots, a Hazmat Hood, and a Hazmat Suit.

217752.name: Mower Mania
217752.description:
Description from the designer:

In these days of recession, it's not that easy to scrape an honest living. But there's always a neighbour’s lawn waiting to be mowed.
Fortunately you have inherited your grandfather’s MowMaster 2000, in it’s day the height of grass removal technology. Unfortunately that day was about 100 years ago and mowing with it now is tricky, due to the machine’s somewhat limited functions.
Mind you don't smash it into those trees, because it'll cost you for repairs and watch out for that dog. Above all try to steer clear of the customers' flower beds and prize vegetables as they get very upset at the sight of beheaded daffodils or mashed marrow.

Mower Mania is a mix of puzzle/strategy (working out best routes through the gardens), resource management (your mower functions) and luck (dice for movement and randomness of garden tile layout).

When you land on a long grass tile, you turn it over to reveal it nicely mowed. Landing on vegetables or flowers, however, results in loss of points (money). Land on a pot, or go too fast into a tree or garden feature, and you'll also sustain damage to your mower.

The amount you earn will be based on how much of the lawn you've successfully mowed (a minimum amount required to progress to the next garden) and how much damage you've caused. You'll then need to pay for mower repairs and to replenish mower functions you used.
.

Mower Mania was an entry in the 2016 Mint Tin Design Contest and did exceptionally well:

1st place: Best Overall Design
1st place: Best Theme
2nd place: Best Artwork & Graphic Design
3rd place: Best Written Rules
Top pick: of Guest Judge, Caroline Berg
.

Thanks to all those at BoardgameGeek who played the game, and gave feedback and suggestions, during the contest, especially:
John Kean, lelo Arrowsmith. Scott Allen, GreenTea532, Laura Blachek, G. Uitz, Janine Viglietti, Marianne Waage, Benjamin Wack, Andrew Orel, Niklas Hook, Alex Johns, melbards and James Ronald Lo.

He needs to get to the Hoover Dam to finish his work - can the PCs help him? But who are the people following him? And what has he got to hide?

A one-shot scenario for 1-6 players and estimated to take 4-6 hours.

Description from the publisher:

The Destination Fun Combo Pack features three full expansions for each game in AEG's Destination Fun series: Trains, Planes, and Automobiles.

Trains: Coastal Tides features all-new cards and strategies for you to build the best rail system in Japan. This expansion not only features new cards, but also three entirely new boards. Two of the boards are designed specifically for two-player games, while the Okayama map is a new challenge for 2 to 4 players. Route bonus cards are also included, allowing you to score additional points for being the first to connect specific stations.

Planes: Round Trip features two new boards, providing more airports to explore. An entire deck of new playing cards allows players to experience the game with new actions and goals. New planes tokens gives players more options to customize airport boards with endless variety.

Automobiles: Racing Season includes three new race tracks, including two that are tighter for two-player games. New garage, pit, handling, performance, and engine cards offer more options for customizing your race car. Season campaign rules allows players to race a series of tracks to determine an overall winner, complete with unique driver skills and wealthy sponsors.

217762.description:
CAMPAIGNS OF DEATH

HARDCOVER CAMPAIGN BOOK!

A hardcover book that has refined rules and guidelines for creating custom campaigns from the core game and our 12 current expansions.

Includes 3 x 30 Lantern year campaigns, each with their own timelines, and a sprinkle of unique innovations, story events,
settlement events, and new gear.

Also includes 2, 3-5 lantern year short format campaigns.

These campaigns will serve as examples of our new node system
and help teach you how to build your own campaigns, where its
appropriate to shift timeline events to prevent overcrowding, how to keep the difficulty balanced at the KD level and when is ok to add a boon type story event (like Hands of Heat).

Includes details about the nodes and power levels of all the current monsters (from the core game to the currently released expansions *NOT NEW EXPANSIONS).

Also includes my personal take on creating custom campaigns.

Content Pitch:
l x Hard cover Book (Est. 60-100 Pages)
1 X Ancient Butcher Monster (50mm or 100mm base)
3 x New Hybrid Armor Set Narrative Sculpts
80 x Game Cards
10 X Gear Cards
3 x campaign Specific Settlement Record Pads
1 x Blank Settlement Record Pad
2 x Character Record Pads
Generous Fistful of new Story Events!

Import / Export is a role selection game with a passive and active economy driven by player decisions.

You have the power to gain over 100 unique powers by exporting shipments of goods, specializing into a varied tech tree, and unlocking advanced game engines that will be completely unique to each play!

Once your shipments enter the open sea, someone can trigger an Import action, where everyone will hold a silent auction to buy your containers and either allocate them as a future end game investment or an immediate boost to their available actions for specific roles.

The end goal of the game is to have the most credits, which will be a combination of your physical credits, passive credits that were saved as imported goods, plus any bonuses from completed shipments.
