Rules to help play in the modern night, including guns, vehicles and chase mechanics

217900.name: Hanger 1A
217900.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a full-color, 48 x 30 Battlemap of a Hangar Bay, with Hex, Square and No Overlays. The Zip file contains a 360 degree view from the centre of the bay and also includes the VTT (Virtual Table Top Images for online play).

“This is your captain. The ship is lost. Grab whatever supplies you can and get out of here. Escape and survive, that is my final order. “—Starship Captain Globel

[Sounds of a door smashing, followed by screams, then dead comms.]

Hangar 1A is a single level interior map of two hangar hatches for fighters or other small ships. There is an upper level walkway along the north and east wall with the main personnel door entrance in the north center with secondary doors in the northwest part of the walkway and just to the east of the main entrance. There are two force fielded hangar door exits in the south wall. Hangar 1A includes a 360-degree panoramic view from the center of the hangar bay.

Hangar 1A is intended for use in near or far-future Science Fiction games.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Breached from Within: Aliens have boarded your starship and breached the bridge. The bridge crew is captured or killed with communications down. Your orders are to gather supplies into the ships and escape the hangar.

But as the player characters gather supplies and get them inside the escape vessels, the access door from the ship to the hangar is breached and aliens enter the room from the walkway above. It’s up to them to decide to try and fight the aliens to buy time to gather more supplies or make a run for it quickly.

After getting out of the hangar, the player character’s escape ship has to evade or fight the alien starship’s fighters to get away.

This adventure hook makes for a good way to launch a campaign as this explains how the group got their initial starting ship as well as establishing a campaign villainous alien race. The choice to gather supplies or not may also lead to a desperate need to get supplies soon after their escape leading to further adventures.

217901.name: In a Pig's Eye
217901.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Godless adventure for Starting Characters!

Old folks tell children of the scary stories of Hog, a flesh-eating goblin who lives deep beneath the earth. For those who believe the stories, Hog is a nightmarish figure who dispatches blind mutants to the surface to harvest meat and other supplies. Some who have scoffed at the stories discovered their error much too late . . .

In a Pig’s Eye is an adventure for starting characters who find themselves as dinner guests of Hog. This adventure puts the characters together in a dangerous scene, develops their origin story, and provides them with reasons to band together. The characters complete this adventure when they escape to the surface.

Written by Andrew Follett and illustrated by Jack Kaiser, this adventure is a perfect way to kick off a campaign in the Godless universe!

217902.name: Ratmen of the Dead Oak
217902.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ratmen of the Dead Oak is a companion adventure made to go along with the events unfolding in Folio #8. It is designed for 1E & 5E mechanics and is for characters level 1-3. It contains the information needed to run a side advenute during the events of The Hidden Valoria Campaign.

You haven't truly been inducted into the culture of Valoria unless you've had dealings ith the mysterious Ratmen. Now, a problme has emerged from an infamous tree in the Patina and only the characters have the unique skills required to deal with it both diplomatically and martially.

217903.name: Gang War!
217903.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gang War! is a companion adventure made to go along with the events unfolding in Folio #9. It is designed for 1E & 5E mechanics and is for characters level 2-5. It contains the information needed to run a side advenute during the events of The Hidden Valoria Campaign.

Yep, you've stepped in it now! Cross blades with several of the gangs of the Patina to help avoid an all-out war that is likely to set the neighborhood ablaze! Once again the players are pressed into service to help keep the peace in the Patina when a rumor of a murder and deciet will pit on gang against another, their tenuous alliances threatening to pull other gnags into the mess as well.

217904.name: XenoShyft: Dreadmire - Brood Expansion
217904.description: The Brood evolves yet again! This Xenoshyft card expansion brings a host of new threats and challenges to the game, adding even more danger and excitement. With 5 new enemies per wave of terror and 3 brand new horrifying bosses to savage your team, the Brood has truly reached a new level of lethality.

217905.name: XenoShyft: Dreadmire – Promo Cards
217905.description:
This set contains exclusive stretch goals from the Xenoshyft: Dreadmire Kickstarter campaign. It contains the following:

18 x Full-Art Brood Boss Cards
20 x Legendary Item Cards (Metallic-Framed)
14 x Exclusive NorTec Hero Cards to upgrade your Dreadmire troops (Metallic-Framed)
36 x Exclusive NorTec Troops (4 types, 9 of each)
8 x Over-sized Division Cards
2 x Exclusive Division Cards
1 x Rules Reference Card

217906.name: The Sanguine Tide
217906.description:
Campaign Background and First Module

From the introduction:

As Neverwinter has steadily recovered from the cataclysmic tear which ran throughout the south eastern city districts, many factions and individuals have flocked to the city to try to establish a foothold in one of the most promising regions in the known world. With surrounding lands rich in natural resources, the ideas of trading, crafting, protecting, thieving, exploiting, praising and praying, have people travelling from all over for a piece of the action. Now with the giant chasm sealed and vacant land up for grabs, many a merchant and individuals are marking plots of land to call their own.
...
A merchant has been asking adventures or sell swords to look into some people disappearing happening within a small Village 32 miles south east of Neverwinter. His brother owns a small mill there and he is worried about the small township.

The local guard are aware of this quest and will point characters towards the merchant who operates a small trader store on the southern outskirts of Neverwinter.

User summary:

For low-level characters.

217907.name: Fantasy Office
217907.description:
User summary:

Random table of 100 smallish things you might find in a fantasy-themed office.

217908.name: Port Master's Office
217908.description:
User summary:

Random table of 100 smallish, nautical-themed things you might find in a port master's office.

217909.name: Fantasy Warehouse
217909.description:
User summary:

Random table of 100 smallish, things you might find in a fantasy-themed warehouse.

217910.name: 36 Dramatic Situations
217910.description:
From the introduction:

Crafting your hook for roleplaying is essential. You want your players to completely buy in to the world you are creating.

Read through the situations below and choose one or more as the core of your campaign story.

217911.name: Porn Stars for Ackwiss
217911.description:
From the introduction:

This is a deadly adventure. But if you’re higher level, it might not be as deadly...

It’s about a giant named Ackwiss, his roaming fortress, and his twenty porn stars (they’re really princesses but who’s going to disagree with a giant?).

He’s captured the party for his entertainment in his coliseum.

217912.name: Gravity Rush - The Maid
217912.description:
User Summary

Includes a costume, four missions, and two challenges. There are eight new trophies for the player to collect. The missions revolve around Kat becoming a maid for Melda in order to earn money to pay back Aujean for 'destroying' his home.

217913.name: Gravity Rush - The Spy
217913.description:
User Summary

Includes a costume, four missions, and two challenges. There are eight new trophies for the player to collect.

217914.name: Gravity Rush - The Military
217914.description:
User Summary

Includes a costume, four missions, and two challenges. There are eight new trophies for the player to collect.

217915.name: LARA
217915.description:
A Generic, Minimalist RPG System

Publisher's blurb:

LARA needs 2 six-sided dice to play (the game amazingly goes faster when everyone has a pair).

LARA also needs people to play with (2-4 are good to go).

All of you will love LARA.

Welcome to the world of LARA: A generic minimalist RPG system that lets you become any character that you can imagine. Take out the dice and gather up your friends and make limitless adventures!

217916.name: Warehouse: A Companion Book for LARA System
217916.description:
User summary:

This sourcebook presents additional equipment available to characters in the game. The document includes mundane, ancient, modern, and futuristic items.

217917.name: The Créche of Set
217917.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Creche of Set is a companion adventure made to go along with the events unfolding in Folio #10. It is designed for 1E & 5E mechanics and is for characters level 4-7. It contains the information needed to run a side advenute during the events of The Hidden Valoria Campaign.

After finding the secret under-passage in the fallen Temple of Tefnut, the party can descend through a stair located between two rooms. Down in the dark they will encounter a fallen tribe of Lizardmen who are now influenced by the mummy Aman-Utep in the halls above. Destroying this tribe, and recovering an artifact they possess, could prove highly valuable to the completion of the Lost Temple adventure.

217918.name: The Living City Campaign Game Master Guidelines and Information
217918.description:
From the introduction:

Being a game master in RPGA events involves making many decisions about character actions, running encounters, portraying NPCs, and adjudicating the effects of traps, spells, and (literally) everything else in the world. Living City events are particularly difficult for the game master, for several reasons.

User summary:

This document provides guidance to Dungeon Masters on how to handle various situations and specific rules during Living City play.

217919.name: The Living City Rules Compendium
217919.description:
From the introduction:

Living City tournaments are held at conventions throughout the world. RPGA Network members play their own characters in these events. The more tournaments you play, the more levels, power, and wealth your character gains.

User summary:

This document provides guidance to players and Dungeon Masters on how to handle various situations and character creation for Living City play.

217920.name: Bequest
217920.description:
User Summary

A house inherited from his beloved grandmother will lead the protagonist into the endless madness.

217921.name: Anonima Gidierre (Numero 95 - Gennaio/Marzo 2017)
rpgissuearticle: Dal Best of Show al Gioco di Ruolo dell'Anno
XXIII Trofeo Rill - Il miglior racconto fantastico

217922.name: Reproduction Man
217922.description:
Reproduction Man is a 2D puzzler where you help some very simple-minded sperm get to the egg. This cult classic of the Windows shareware era was brought back for its 20th anniversary with all-new graphics, animation and sound. Its outward cuteness belies some very tough puzzles.

Source: The Game Website.

217923.name: Power Hover
217923.description:
Take control of the hoverboarding robots, explore the desolate world, defy gravity, dive into the oceans and ride with the sandworms on the dunes! Stylish graphics and groovy soundtrack will take you to an epic adventure in this action/racing game.

Source: The Developer Website.

217924.name: Fall of Stalingrad
217924.description:
User Summary

This is part of Joni Nuutinen's Conflict Series. The player takes the role of German forces and their Axis allies at the dawn of the Soviet counter-offensive that encircled the city of Stalingrad and sealed the fate of the German 6th Army and turned the tide of World War II in Europe.

The Axis forces are on the defensive as the Soviets pour through the lines and the Axis forces are stifled by command confusion and unable to move. Can you prevent the encirclement of Stalingrad and retake the initiative. The game has varying levels of difficulty to make for just the right challenge.

217925.name: SteamHammerVR - The Rogue Apprentice - London 1892
217925.description:
Your adventure takes place in Victorian London 1892. The dastardly Professor Rattwurm is attempting to enslave the fine English folk with his multitude of clockwork automatons! Armed with your steam powered weapons, can you save old London Town?

Source: The Publisher Website.

217927.name: Day of the Dwarf
217927.description:
A Two-Round Living City Adventure
Round One: Trouble in Shadystreets

From the introduction:

The strange and bizarre are commonplace in the city of Ravens Bluff. Today though many of the city’s inhabitants are in for a rude awakening. Who is behind it? Can we stop it? Is there a cure? These are just a few of the questions you need to answer!

A role-playing intensive event.

Part 2 of the Destiny of Dwarves saga.

For tiers 1-5.

217928.name: News of the World
217928.description:
A One-Round Living City Adventure
For Character Levels 1 - 19
Part 3 of the Devil of the Deep Series

From the introduction:

The only news these days is bad news. The dockside reporter for the Ravens Bluff Trumpeter has been abducted. Can you rescue her before an old enemy of the city can wreak more havoc?

217929.name: Magic School
217929.description:
A One-Round Adventure

From the introduction:

After a little "independent study," the three newest students at Soredomo Magic Academy return to find their entire school kidnapped! Together with three other area kids, can they discover the truth behind the sinister actions of the Cabal?

A light-hearted, humorous adventure for six 1st level kids. (D&D 3e version of the AD&D scenario of the same name.)

217930.name: Stormbreaker
217930.description:
A One-Round Living City Adventure

From the introduction:

Low Level: Aleesia, Moonmistress of the Full Moon, asks for your help in finding and destroying a threat to the
Temple of Selune.

High Level: Aleesia, Moonmistress of the Full Moon, asks for your help in guarding the war galley Stormbreaker
on her maiden voyage.

217931.name: Swan Song
217931.description:
A One-Round Living City Adventure

From the introduction:

Cancelled concerts, quiet taverns, and postponed poetry readings - where have all the bards gone?

An adventure for characters level 1-10.

217932.name: A Living City Player's Guide to the Meta-campaign Options
217932.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the Living City!

The City of Ravens Bluff is home to the largest community of adventurers in the Forgotten Realms campaign setting. As such, there is always a flurry of activity as this adventuring group goes here, does this and that and comes home victorious. However not all adventurers are out and about on a daily basis. Some of them have real jobs, commitments and organizations that they have pledged time too. This handbook details some of those organizations and activities as the Living City directors and coordinators have restructured them.

Although it is far from all-inclusive, it is hoped that this gives you a basic idea and understanding of what the new look of the organizations and activities are and how you can interact with them in the campaign.

rpgseries: TSS - Living Greyhawk Splintered Suns and Scarlet Signs Meta-Regional Adventures
217933.name: The Splintered Sun Meta-Game Book
217933.description:
A Supplement for the Living Greyhawk Campaign Setting

From the introduction:

Once the Golden of Aerdy was the light of the Flanaess, a shining bastion of civilisation and culture. Now that sun is splintered into a handful of successor states, struggling amongst themselves to reclaim some small fragment of their glorious birthright. In the heartlands of Aerdy, two Overkings vie for a debased throne, a tarnished crown and a lost city. In the South, the states of the once-proud Iron League fight desperately to resist the insidious tendrils of the Scarlet Brotherhood and their nested conspiracies to restore another lost empire - the ancient Suel Imperium.

217934.name: Napoléon 1806
217934.description:
Description from the publisher:

On August 9, 1806, Frederick William of Prussia, in reaction to the recent creation of the Confederation of the Rhine by Napoleon, decreed the order of mobilization. War becomes unavoidable.

The Prussian army concentrates on Erfürt without waiting for the troops of its Russian ally. Outrunning his opponents, Napoleon enters Saxony with the Grand Army on October 7, 1806 and heads for Berlin.

A week later the Prussians, defeated at Jena and Auerstaedt, retreat North. The pursuit led by the Murat cavalry can begin...

When the game meets history:

Napoleon 1806 is a game at the crossroads of history and simulation.
Napoleon 1806 is the culmination of two history and wargame enthusiasts, Denis Sauvage and Julien Busson, who wished to share this passion with you.
With Napoleon 1806, in 1 to 2 hours, two players will relive the clashes between Prussian and French at the heart of the imperial conquests of Napoleon the 1st, which culminated in the battles of Auerstaedt and Jena.

Napoleon 1806 is intended for wargaming seasoned grognards as well as for young conscripts who want to try a new playful sensation. Strategy, anticipation and decision are the engines of the Napoleon 1806 game system.

The rules of Napoleon 1806 are divided into three parts and can be learnt in fifteen minutes. The first one, called "Rules of the Conscript", allows to acquire all the notions of the game easily. The second, "Rules of the Grognard", brings more finesse including "fog of war". The last, "Rules of the Marshal", allows to play Napoleon 1806 in competition.

Will you meet the challenge of doing as well as the Emperor Napoleon or will you succeed in thwarting his plans at the head of the Prussian forces?

How to play Napoleon 1806:

A game of Napoleon 1806 is played in 7 turns, each representing two days of campaign. Players alternate operations with their army corps. Fatigue and losses accumulate until the breaking point of one of the two armies causing the defeat of a player.

The game is based on cards to perform moves and combats. Even if luck is present, strategy is key to victory. Moving your army corps on different approach paths to facilitate maneuvers, managing the fatigue of your men generated by marching and fighting, concentrating your forces in order to win the decisive battle; these are the challenges you will face.

The French troops are more numerous and more experienced than those of their opponent, but time is short before the arrival of the Russian reinforcements, and the Prussian army is not to be underestimated! The French player to win will have to master the art of attacking and speed of action. The Prussian player, although defensive, will have to seize the opportunities presented to him to counter-attack and surprise his opponent. As the game is fast, each player will have the opportunity to take charge of the fate of both armies in one evening.

217935.name: Krestible City
217935.description:
From the introduction:

Krestible City – Where mountain meets plain. This traditional centre of trade has grown into Perrenland’s third largest city and is the gateway for trade through the Yatil Mountains. A power centre for no less than three major clans – the Hüssens, Rósrijders and Weisspeers – the city is a place where rough Hooglanders rub shoulders with cultured Laaglanders. A place where new ideas butt heads with old traditions. A place where adventure is but a few steps away.

217936.name: The Krestible Project
217936.description:
From the introduction:

This document is compiled from contributions made by entrants to the Krestible Competition in 2003. The author of each entry is listed with the entry.

217937.name: Heirs of Elemental Evil
217937.description:
A Two-Round Planescape Adventure

From the introduction:

You’re off to the outer planes, where you have to... babysit? Couldn't you have stayed home for that? I mean, a basher like you babysitting? These children hold the fate of the multiverse? Not likely, but if the jink's good you got yourself a babysitter.

An adventure for characters levels 5-7, characters provided.

User summary:

An RPGA Network tournament.

217938.name: The Scroll of Heaven
217938.description:
A Two-Round Team Tournament

From the introduction:

"There will be a time," the aged Master says to the group of young students seated before him, "when you will continue the paths of your lives beyond the walls of this humble place. You will embark on many journeys in your lifetimes, for many different purposes. But always remember that the true path, the one that leads to destiny, never ends."

User summary:

An RPGA Network Tournament scenario.

217939.name: Rise & Shine
217939.description:
Welcome to Gamearth, a once peaceful planet now threatened by the warmongering Space grunts of Nexgen. In the aftermath of their devastating first strike a child named Rise is forced to take on the sacred gun Shine - and with it the fate of his world.

Source: The Developer Website.

217940.name: Sylvio
217940.description:
Sylvio is a psychological horror game set in a tranquil, disturbing atmosphere. Help ghost recorder Juliette Waters face an evil curse and a wicked family cult with her microphone and the voices of the dead.

Source: The Game Website.

217941.name: Friday Night Bullet Arena
videogamehonor: 2017 SXSW Gamer's Voice: Best Indie Game of the Year (Multiplayer) Nominee
217941.description:
Friday Night Bullet Arena is a top-down multiplayer shoot-a-thon with a twist: each player only gets one bullet! You can catch your own bullet to fire again, but catching other bullets is... not recommended.

Source: The Game Website.

217942.name: Cold Vengeance
217942.description:
When Canada invades the USA, Sgt. Jon Dagger must run and gun his way across the ruins of America to the Frozen North to deliver Cold Vengeance.

Source: The Developer Website.

217943.name: Unhack 2
217943.description:
In this sequel to Unhack, the unhacker returns with his new AI companion to battle Program X and her clones.

Source: The Developer Website.

217944.description:
Make your shots in Dead Panic count for more with a Laser Sight.
Play this promo card when using a Rifle, Pistol, or Shotgun to deal one additional point of damage to the target Zombie.
217944.name: Dead Panic: Laser Sight Promo Card

217945.name: Executive Producer
217945.description: Executive Producer is a worker placement board game where players attempt to maximize profits from making movies. Acquiring the proper actors, directors, and locations for a given script is imperative for financial success. Each script is categorized as either action, comedy, drama, or horror. Actors, directors, and locations are tailored for certain roles and must be selected carefully. Properly marketing films allows players to collect residual income as they prepare for their next film premiere. Players are tasked each turn with allocating meeples for casting, purchasing scripts, marketing, fundraising, or acquiring bonus features, as they strive to become the most successful Executive Producer in the industry!

217946.name: Shimmer and Shine: Genie Friends Forever Game
217946.description:
Shimmer and Shine Genie Friends Forever Game is based on an excitingly-new, animated preschool series on Nick Jr.

Players join in on magical adventures that sometimes don't go quite as planned!
It's up to the three girls to work collaboratively to solve problems as they discover their way and learn from their mistakes

The game encourages counting and social interaction. No reading required

217947.description:
Catan: Seefahrer is an expansion for Catan that includes many water hexes — as well as many different water-hex-heavy variant set-ups — in which players can build shipping lanes, which function similar to roads.

Catan: Seefahrer – 20 Jahre Jubiläums-Edition includes four new scenarios packaged under the title "Die Legende der Seeräuber".
217947.name: Catan: Seefahrer – 20 Jahre Jubiläums-Edition

217948.name: Quack Quack
217948.description:
It's time for an exciting duck race on the lake!

Each player in Quack Quack gets a headband with a wobbly duck, then sits down. The start command "Quack Quack!" starts all players moving at the same time. If one moves with the duck dangling from their headband near the eggs, the magnet on the duck attracts the eggs, which the player must then deposit as quickly as possible on their own water lily. If no eggs of a color are left in the pond, the player with that color has won this crazy race!

217949.name: A Column of Fire
217949.description:
A Column of Fire is an adaptation of the third novel in Ken Follett's "Kingsbridge" series following The Pillars of the Earth and World Without End. (The novel is titled A Column of Fire in English, and Das Fundament der Ewigkeit ("The Foundation of Eternity") in German.)

In the game, set in Europe during the time of Elizabeth I, Catholics and Protestants compete for power and influence in England, France, Spain, and the Netherlands. In this politically unstable environment, resourceful operatives and courageous secret agents plot to secure power for their rulers. The balance of power shifts back and forth amidst foiled assassinations, successful rebellions, and futile invasions — and not infrequently, those who sympathize with the weak are expelled from the country.

The real enemies, then as now, are not the rival religions. The true battle pits those who believe in tolerance and compromise against the tyrants who would impose their ideas on everyone else — no matter what the cost. Who will best exploit the changing power conditions in Europe to win the game?

boardgameintegration: Steal The Show! Theatrical Party Card Game
Steal The Show! Theatrical Party Card Game
217950.description:
Are you ready for Act II? Play as iconic characters as you challenge players to a Battle of Strength or a Battle of Wits using Shakespearean insults and the art of bluffing!

Steal The Show! is a race to collect five comedy masks, and the first player to do so wins. If a player receives five tragedy masks first, however, they're eliminated from the game. In more detail, each player takes on the role of a character. Characters have unique gameplay abilities as well as a strength value (used in a Battle of Strength) and a wit value (used in a Battle of Wits). One location card is always in play and changes throughout the course of the game; location cards modify the rules of the game.

Action cards (Insults) are used during battle to enhance the strength and wit value of the character as well as insert some trickery to mix! Don't forget bluffing! Players can use bluffing techniques to assist with a numerical boost as well!

Steal The Show! Act II: Theatrical Party Card Game is a standalone expansion for Steal The Show! that features new characters, new locations, and new actions/insults that can be played on their own or in combination with the first game.
217950.name: Steal The Show! Act II: Theatrical Party Card Game

217951.name: Palace of the Silver Princess (DIY Remix)
217951.description:
From the introduction:

B3: Palace of the Silver Princess (Orange), is an old TSR dungeon module. I gave 30-odd of my favorite DIY D&D writers a page of it to rewrite each, with nobody knowing what anyone else was up to, then I smoothed out and edited the whole thing together.

I was alarmed to find the whole thing fit together quite nicely and arguably makes more sense than the original. Though you should still be able to use the same maps as in the original, everything else has been changed.

217952.name: Monstrous Collection
217952.description:
From the back cover:

This collection contains the majority of the monsters released under the Advanced Dungeons & Dragons 2nd edition system. It compiles the monsters from the Monstrous Manual, all of the Monstrous Compendium books (including the Monstrous Compendium Annuals), most of the monsters from various AD&D game products, as well as most monsters appearing in Dragon magazine.

User summary:

This unauthorized and copyright-infringing compilation contains page reproductions of virtually every monster in virtually every commercial product (note page count) produced for the game. It includes a complete alphabetic index.

217953.name: Not Necessarily the Monstrous Compendium
217953.description:
From the cover:

?? Edition
Out new bestiary - or maybe it's our worstiary. You tell us.
Tin Golem, Gello Monsters, and Ticklers

User summary:

This unauthorized and copyright-infringing compilation contains page reproductions of various satiric, useless, or just plain stupid monsters commercially published for Advanced Dungeons & Dragons, 2nd Edition. Monsters are arranged in semi-alphabetical order, sort of.

217956.name: F.A.T.A.L. Character Generator
217956.description:
User summary:

The F.A.T.A.L. Character Generator is a standalone executable file for MS Windows systems. It allows rapid generation of a character which is saved as a text file on program exit. The system solicits input, however for most choices if the user selects a specific outcome (rather than a random one), an additional "mental illness" penalty is placed upon the character.

Note users must self-certify they are 18+ to use the software.

217958.name: The Legends of Owlia
217958.description:
The Legends of Owlia is Gradual Games' second release for the NES, now ported for your PC! It is an action-adventure game inspired by StarTropics, Crystalis, and the Legend of Zelda. Guide heroine Adlanniel and her owl friend Tyto to free the great owls and defeat Mermon king of the Mermen!!

Source: The Developer Website.

217959.name: Scrabble: Harry Potter Edition
217959.description:
Description from the publisher:

Bringing the words and magic of HARRY POTTER to life!
Scrabble Harry Potter Edition brings a new level of magical mischief and fun to the world's favorite word game

Be sorted into one of the four HOGWARTS Houses!
Draw special cards when your word crosses a HOGWARTS space!
Use Spells and Potions to increase your score, and flummox your opponents!
Earn bonus points for playing words from the exclusive HARRY POTTER Word List!

217960.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game (Second Edition)  – Watchers on the Wall
boardgamefamily: A Song of Ice and Fire
217960.description:
Description from the publisher:

Travel north and join the Night’s Watch with Watchers on the Wall! Within this expansion, the Night’s Watch explores new and existing themes, as you find new ways to defend the Wall, new ways to conscript your opponent’s characters, and plenty of rewards for focusing on the three branches of the Night’s Watch: Rangers, Stewards, and Builders. Along with the nameless men who swell the ranks of the Night’s Watch, you’ll find new versions of iconic characters from throughout the saga, including Jon Snow, Old Bear Mormont, Maester Aemon, and Samwell Tarly.

And although the focus of this expansion rests on the Night’s Watch, you’ll find two new non-loyal cards for every other faction, expanding your options for any alliance. You’ll also receive an assortment of neutral cards portraying the Night’s Watch’s most common enemies, the Wildlings. With seven new plots (one loyal to the Night’s Watch) rounding out the expansion, Watchers on the Wall offers new pathways to victory for every deck.

217961.name: Dungeon Brawl
217961.description:
Description from the publisher:

You and your fellow adventurers have completed what you thought was a typical dungeon crawl. With the dungeon cleared and boss defeated, the treasure is yours for the taking... or so you thought. There's a disagreement as to who gets what. Talking leads to arguing. Arguing leads to yelling. Suddenly, there's a twinkle of light and a flash of steel. Everyone reactively jumps back, weapons at the ready. Each person eyes the other as they all stare back knowingly. There's no turning back now. It's now become a Dungeon Brawl.

Dungeon Brawl is a customizable, take-that, free for all for 3 to 5 players. In this 20 to 60 minute game, players draft 1 of 5 classes then customize it by constructing a deck consisting of weapons, armor, items, and abilities. Draft your treasure, then drop into the dungeon with your so-called "friends". Your cards determine what actions you can take. Deal out damage in order to give your opponents Wounds. Wounds are added to your deck when it runs out, slowing you down by impeding your hand size. Once the Wound deck runs out, the game ends and the adventurer with the least amount of Wounds takes all the treasure and is declared the winner!

217962.name: GRENADE!
217962.description:
Description from the designer:

GRENADE! is a quick card and dice game for 2-4 people.

All players have a hidden card on their hand that matches one on the table. By roling and moving dice they try to eliminate the other players.

217963.name: In The Company of Giants (5E)
217963.description:
From publisher blurb:

Now in 5th Edition!!!

From Ogers to Storm Giants...it's time to prove Bigger is Better.

In the Company of Giants allows 5e players to begin play as giant(though perhaps not the largest of giants), and gain powers tied to their giantness as they gain levels! If you have ever wanted to be Large and In Charge, this is the product for you!

Within these pages you will find:

The core Jotunnar race.
A racial paragon class balanced for play alongside your adventuring companions, designed for use by player character’s at every level of play.
Custom special abilities and feats based on elemental powers and giant subraces such as ettins, trolls, and frost giants.
A first—person narrative discussions about giant culture, attitude, and physiology, fleshing out the nature of the new giant race.
17 feats designed for giant PCs, drawing on these characters’ rock throwing ability and their racial heritage to grant them expanded abilities.

217964.name: Kineticists of Porphyra IV
217964.description:
From publisher blurb:

More Kinetic Power to Satisfy Any Campaign!

The power keeps coming, in the next and FOURTH installment of Kineticist of Porphyra! N Jolly’s Kineticists of Porphyra 4 from Purple Duck Games continues the popular series with even more of your favorite new occult class. This latest in the series introduces a bewildering array of new material; 4 new archetypes, including the aberrant kineticist, energy roper, entropist and kinetic lancer; 2 new enigmatic elemental saturations; 12 new composite blasts, 13 new infusions; 43 new utility wild talents; 12 combo wild talents; 18 new kineticist-centered feats; 4 new elemental mutations; a new magic weapon quality and 2 new magic items, and a complete 12th level sample character!

217965.name: Dazzleship Battleships
217965.description:
Description from the publisher:

This game is based on one of the most unconventional ideas ever to have come out of international warfare – dazzle ships! Inspired by the shock and awe of Cubism and Vorticism, the dazzle ships of the First World War used a striking form of bold camouflage to confuse enemy attackers.

Use this wonderfully oddball idea to confuse your opponent and evade attacks on your fleet with this new version of the ever-popular battleships game. Includes two 64-page map-and-grid books for playing the game and a 16-page booklet explaining the history of the dazzle ships and the artistic inspiration behind them.

217966.name: Spacenoir: A Bulldogs! Technoir Transmission
217966.description:
From publisher blurb:

TransGalaxy Pangalactic Corporation. One of the largest and most powerful entities in the galaxy. Though the Company has their fingers in everything these days, they started out as a shipping service, and that’s still a core part of their business.

Class D Shipping Division. The difficult and hazardous cargo section of the Company’s shipping arm. Home of the desperate, the unqualified, and the just plain stupid. That’s where you ended up, most likely through fault of your own. The Company buys whatever junkers they can find for cheap, hires anyone who applies, insures the Hell out of the whole thing, and crosses their fingers that you losers can deliver enough hazardous cargo to hostile destinations to make it worth their while.

You are so desperate, such a fuck-up, or so insane that you took on this job. Unfortunately, so are your crewmates and so is your captain. Best of luck surviving your five-year contract!

Spacenoir is a Technoir Transmission using the mad galaxy featured in Bulldogs! You need a copy of Technoir to play.

217967.name: Mindjammer: Transhuman Adventure in the Second Age of Space
217967.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Ennie Award-winning transhuman science-fiction RPG setting returns, in a brand new edition for use with the TRAVELLER roleplaying game!

This brand new 384-page hardback book includes:

full rules for starships, organisations, and culture operations;
detailed character cultures, genotypes, and new careers—play a sentient starship!
new and innovative systems for describing planets, star systems, and alien life;
deep setting material on the New Commonality of Humankind;
rules for the Mindscape and virtual worlds;
starmaps and planet descriptions, histories and background.




THE UNIVERSE AWAITS!

Never has there been a greater time of opportunity. The universe is in flux, and for the first time in ten thousand years no one knows what the future will bring. Charge your blaster, thoughtcast your orders to the starship sentience, and fire up the planing engines. Come and defend the light of humanity's greatest civilisation as it spreads to the stars!

217968.description:
Bored Room is an easy-to-play, but hard-to-win party game pitting you against your co-workers in a series of challenges taking place during a work meeting! That's right, your company is going to be paying you while you play this game. That's definitely a win-win! *cough*

Three dice are rolled before the meeting, comparing the results to the list of activities. All players attend the meeting and complete as many of the rolled challenges as possible to score points. After the meeting ends, players reconvene to tally up scores and declare a winner.

With multiple modes of gameplay and included badges of honor, you'll be sure to liven up your stuffy work environment in no time!
217968.name: Bored Room

217969.name: Gnomes vs Zombies
217969.description:
Be quick to trap the zombies that have invaded the garden. Observe, be alert and use the hunters to help you trap the zombies. To win the game, accumulate as many game cards as possible.

Goal of the game: be the player who has accumulated the most cards at the end of the game. In turn, each player places a card on the central stack of cards. As soon as a player returns a
zombie hunter, the next player must provide the same number of cards as indicated by the hunter. The player who has returned the zombie hunter picks up the whole central stack and puts it after his own stack of cards. Keep an eye open, because as soon as two identical cards follow each other, the first player to hit the central stack picks it up and deposits it in his prison. These cards belong to him for the rest of the game.

217972.description: Bloody Mary, a promotional character card for BANG! included with Spielbox #6 of 2016, has this unique ability: Each time your BANG! card is Missed!, draw one card from the deck.
217972.name: BANG! Bloody Mary

217973.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – C-ROC Cruiser Expansion Pack
217973.description:
Description from the publisher:

Safeguard your fortunes with the C-ROC Cruiser Expansion Pack for X-Wing! Designed for use in the game's Cinematic Play and Epic Play formats, the C-ROC Cruiser Expansion Pack contains one C-ROC Cruiser miniature, one M3-A Interceptor miniature with an alternate paint scheme, seven ship cards, thirty upgrade cards, and all the maneuver dials, damage decks, tokens, and game pieces that you need to fly your C-ROC Cruiser and its escort to battle. Additionally, the expansion includes a new campaign for Cinematic Play in which your C-ROC draws the ire of either the Galactic Empire or Rebel Alliance.

217974.name: Bemused
217974.description:
Bemused is a card game for 4-6 players in which the players take on the role of a muse seeking to elevate their chosen human virtuoso to the greatest height of celebrity and influence. To do so, the muse must eliminate their virtuoso's rivals by levying doubts and dreads upon them until they are driven insane...or worse. Bemused is not a social deduction game. Although there are deductive elements, the game is a social interaction experience that encourages shameless table talk, bluffing, and deal-making as players seek to maximize their end game scores.

Each player has a virtuoso card that designates their human protégé and a hand of doubt and dread cards. Each turn, the player draws two doubt cards for their hand, places a doubt or dread card from their hand onto a virtuoso card, then discards a card from their hand. In some cases, a player may play two doubt cards from their hand, but this action permanently reduces their hand size. Each virtuoso has an ability that their muse may use, such as change a dread to a doubt or move a doubt from one virtuoso to another. Scheming, negotiating, and table talk are encouraged!

When a virtuoso is saddled with a combined total of five doubt and/or dread cards, the virtuoso is driven insane. An insane virtuoso still gets their turn and may still win the game, but their options for which cards they may play on their turn is limited by their insanity. If an insane virtuoso has more dread than doubts, that virtuoso dies and becomes a fantasma that haunts the remaining living virtuosos. A fantasma may still win the game!

Each muse's protégé also has a gemina, a secret virtuoso in the game that holds a psychic link with their protégé, and a secret that describes how their protégé feels about their gemina, and how the player's score will be affected by the state of their protégé's gemina when the game ends (e.g., the player may gain points if their virtuoso's gemina is not insane at the end of the game). Once a virtuoso's gemina is revealed, a player may use the gemina's ability as well as their protégé's ability! A player may may reveal and use their virtuoso's gemina for a price... but whenever a virtuoso goes insane, their gemina automatically flips over and can have severe consequences for play...

217977.description:
An abstract strategy game that sees you not only controlling your own pieces, but also determining a lot of your opponent's piece movements through the control of colours.

Lure and Colour Chess are played on the same board but with different pieces and goals. Or you can combine the two!

Lure is a game of blocking, manipulation and capture that can be played with a different combination of pieces to change up the strategy.

Colour Chess keeps the standard rules of chess but adds a second layer of strategy based on the board's colours. This removes a lot of the standard openings of chess and means you have to adapt your strategy to the board each time you play.
217977.name: Lure + Colour Chess

217978.description:
An additional Dragon Rage card featuring unique artwork.

This promo card was available to backers of the Dragon Whisperer Kickstarter.
217978.name: Dragon Whisperer: Shadow Whisperer Dragon Rage Promo Card

217979.description:
These promo cards for Dragon Whisperer function as a mini-expansion. They function similarly to Dragon Rage cards and feature unique artwork and new icons.

From the errata:
"The Promo Cards are used like the Dragon Rage cards. The difference is that, when used, the person who plays the last promo card wins the trick instead of it just cancelling the round."

These promo cards were available to certain tiers of backers during the Kickstarter.
boardgameversion: Dragon Whisperer: Kickstarter Promo Cards - First Edition
217979.name: Dragon Whisperer: Kickstarter Promo Cards

217983.name: The Moon is a Harsh Master
217983.description:
From publisher blurb:

The long-delayed sequel to Come to the Temple is finally out..

“MAYDAY, MAYDAY, this is Strategic Research Station Haven. We are under attack! We need immediate assistance! We think they’re extraterrestrials. They arrived in a massive carrier ship and are seeking entry into the station. We managed to push them back, but we have casualties, are nearly out of ammunition, and the solar capacitor has burnt out. SEND HELP NOW!”

The Moon is a Harsh Master is an adventure for Fainting Goat’s Stark City Campaign Setting and the ICONS Role Playing Game. The adventure is designed for 3 or more PC heroes but can be scaled down to solo play.

217984.name: A Place and Time for Death
217984.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Place and Time for Death is a companion adventure made to go along with the events unfolding in Folio Digital Quarterly #1. It is designed for 1E & 5E mechanics and is for characters level 1-3. It contains the information needed to run a side adventure that will help characters establish themselves in the setting before the events that take place in the Folio Digital Quarterly #1.

Far out in the uncharded territories, the Enlightened still cling to life, but the ever encroaching presense of the xenophobic Samaya threatens the last of their hidden enclaves.

Now, a bounty hunter has been dispatched to deal with the supposed Enlightened sympathizers in the border town of Hogan's Hooch, but there is more to the story than meets the eye. Unbeknownst to the citizens of the town and old relic of the Final War is the price the bounty hunter seeks. Can the party find a way to thwart the bounty hunter and deal with the relic before it falls into the hands of Samaya willing to use it ot sway the balance of power in the world?

217985.name: OneDice B Movies: Double Features
217985.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure double bill for OneDice B Movies...

When animals attack, the USSR must defend! It's time to fight LAIKA'S WAR!

Scientists have opened a dimensional portal in Nevada - and the people of Portal Anomaly Investigation and Containment are the only ones between us and who-knows-what? It's time for PANIC!

217986.name: Conquering Heroes
217986.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sure, you can do what you want, feed from the locals, and go back to hiding in your lair when you’re done.
You may think you’re safe there, it sure feels safe.

But, you aren’t the only thing connected to the Primordial Dream, and no lair is safe from what lurks beyond.

Don’t fool yourself.

— Naomi Walker, Ugalla

A Night Horrors Sourcebook for the Beast: the Primordial RPG

This book includes:

An in-depth look at how Heroes hunt and what makes a Hero, with eleven new Heroes to drop into any chronicle.
A brief look at why Beasts may antagonize one another, with seven new Beasts to drop into any chronicle.
Rules for Insatiables, ancient creatures born of the Primordial Dream intent on hunting down Beasts to fill a hunger without end, featuring six examples ready to use in any chronicle.

217987.name: Murder: il Gioco di Carte
217987.description:
Detective Boso has been murdered! Suspicious falls on some of the main characters of his previous investigations.
Every player will have to gather as much clues as he can to solve the riddle and bring the suspected to the trial: you choose randomly the color of your suspect and noone knows it. Every players receive four cards with three cubes random coloured: every cube is a clue that lead to the suspected of the same color. You choose to play the card that maximize the gathering of clues for your suspected pay attention not to be discovered and minimizing the clues for the suspected of other colors.
The game is based on a mix of strategy and luck, but mostly on bluffing skills.

217988.name: The guys of the murder
217988.description: Help the detective Boso, convincing him of the correctness of your hypothesis emerged from your investigation: move (every move is a clue) your token towards the case solution as you gather clues that prove that the character that you suspect is the murder. Every player will have to gather as much clues as he can to solve the riddle and bring the suspected to the trial: you choose randomly the color of your suspect and noone knows it. Every players receive four cards with three cubes random coloured: every cube is a clue that lead to the suspected of the same color. You choose to play the card that maximize the gathering of clues for your suspected pay attention not to be discovered and minimizing the clues for the suspected of other colors.

217989.name: 24 godziny
217989.description:
You are detectives and have 24 turns (every turn is one hour from the title) to found all clues and witness to stop the villains. Every turn you will take a SMS card that will do something with game. Sometimes it could help you - you can have extra steps to go in this round. Sometimes it can force you to find some clue again or to go to some specific place to recover something. You win if you will find all 16 clues/witness, before the ending of last turn.

Co-operative and very random game. Good to play with kids.

217990.name: Stellar Horizon
217990.description:
Stellar Horizon is a "build your own space program" game where you will lead one of seven Earth Factions to explore and develop our solar system. Designed by a real-life space engineer with a PhD in long-duration spaceflight from MIT, Stellar Horizon is intended to be a plausible representation of the first steps of humanity towards the stars between 2030 and 2169, with each turn representing a year of time. You control your Faction’s space program, outposts, and fleets spanning across the solar system, although you will also have some influence over your Faction’s politics back home on Earth as space development becomes more important.

Gameplay is reminiscent of Master of Orion, Civilization, and other 4X games (eXplore, eXpand, eXploit, and eXterminate). Movement is based on real physics: you’ll move from orbit to orbit, or conduct long range transfers to move between planetary systems like Earth, Mars, or Jupiter. As you send out robotic explorers and crewed vehicles to explore the solar system, they’ll bring back valuable data to further your scientific research. Technologies are intended to represent plausible extrapolations of existing development during the next 150 years: there are no transporters or warp drive, but you will be able to develop rockets powered by fusion and even anti-matter. In the engineering and biology domains, you’ll eventually be able to construct space elevators and put your crews into safe hibernation for long journeys.

You’ll design your own ships using over 50 different component types based on your level of technology on the tech tree. There range from tiny probes intended to merely take photographs as you fly past Jupiter, to giant destroyers, cruisers, and battleships which ply the space lanes with peaceful or hostile intentions. The policies you choose will determine your focus (robotic, crewed, economic, diplomatic, settlement, or military), allowing you to draw new ship and base components you'll use to design and construct your ships and bases. These range from ship components like engine rooms, medical bays, airlocks, and command centers, or weapons and defenses like lasers, rail guns, and stealth systems, to base facilities like mining stations, research labs, or spaceports.

You’ll be given a budget to spend on Earth and can also build bases to harvest minerals, organics, and fuel to expands your economy. You can also forge diplomatic relationships with players and non-player factions alike, and trade resources at their bases to earn extra cash. Each of the seven factions (North America, South America, Europe, Russia, Japan, China, and Asia) has different strengths, weaknesses, abilities, and available ships based on their unique geopolitical situation. Military conflict is certainly possible but not always encouraged. Stellar Horizon features more diplomatic, technological, and economic competition than outright combat, although neglecting warships entirely leaves you vulnerable to pirates, trade embargoes, and sneak attacks by rogue players and factions.

Stellar Horizon includes short co-operative and competitive scenarios lasting an hour or more, and campaigns lasting a day up to about a full weekend for experienced players. Up to seven players can play at a time and the game is most fun with at least 2, but there are also 1-player scenarios, and the campaigns are highly suited for solo play. There are three ways to win the campaign: be the first to develop an Interstellar Colonizer, terraform a world, or achieve dominance in space over your rivals.

rpg: MASHED: A Korean War MASH RPG
217991.name: MASHED: A Korean War MASH RPG
217991.description:
(publisher blurb)

MASHED is a tabletop roleplaying game that uses Powered by the Apocalypse rules to explore the value of human life and the stresses of war—but it’s also about relationships. And courage. And laughter. And love.

Although your characters spend long hours performing surgery, MASHED compresses these into short events to focus on the most dramatic moments. Much of the game actually occurs outside of the operating tent, at times when the flow of casualties has ebbed. Here you may fall in or out of love, fight the orders of ineffective top brass, set up pranks, help your South Korean allies, pick fights, seduce your way through the unit, pull rank, and much more.

If you can find ways to relax amid the horrors of surgery and war, you might get rotated home with your sanity intact. Just remember that you’re practicing medicine in a combat zone—and death isn’t confined to the operating tent.

217992.name: Blue Rose (2nd Edition)
217992.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the world of Blue Rose, a fantastic realm where brave heroes, gifted with arcane powers, live and work side-by-side with intelligent animal companions. The heroes of the peaceful Kingdom of Aldis strive to uphold the ideals of fairness, justice, and equality, while protecting their homeland against its aggressive neighbors, including the fundamentalist Theocracy of Jarzon and the dark land of Kern with its monstrous rulers.

Blue Rose is a roleplaying game of romantic fantasy, where you and your friends take on the roles of the main characters in this fantastic world, creating your own stories about the heroes of Aldis, their triumphs and their tragedies—like writing your own fantasy novel but where you play the heroes! You may have played other roleplaying games, or this may be your introduction to new worlds of adventure. Either way—welcome, friends, to the world of Blue Rose.

For Aldis, and the Queen!

217993.name: Assault on the Necrospire
217993.description:
Assault on the Necrospire is a roguelike with an emphasis on interesting loot and character building. Your mission is to destroy the Necromancer. Wipe the dust off your spellbook; you're going to need it.

Source: The Game Website.

217994.name: Super Death Arena
217994.description:
Super Death Arena is an online horde mode survival game where you fight increasingly larger waves of mutants. Survive ten waves to win, and level up to get loot boxes with new fun gear to customize your character.

Source: The Developer Website.

217995.name: Blackwater Bayou VR
217995.description:
User Summary

It has been only a few weeks since they came. The aliens have taken a majority of the population centers out and are working on remote areas now. As far as you know everyone is already dead.

217996.name: Fluffy
217996.description:
User Summary

Fluffy is a furry creature who is afraid of the rain.

217997.name: Tiny Thor
217997.description:
User Summary

Tiny Thor – Become a HeroSlip into the role of the legendary Thunder God Thor. Battle throngs of enemies with your hammer, collect coins and jewels, solve switch puzzles and explore intricate mazes.

217999.name: Low Magic Age
217999.description:
Low Magic Age is a fantasy RPG that focused on turn-based, party-based tactical combat. The most unique feature of the combat system is various kinds of strategy elements, such as war fog, field of view, ZOC (zone of control), cover and flanking, etc.

Source: The Game Website.
